items.title: Senior Python Developer
items.content:
Location: Remote, Europe
Job Type: Full Time
Start Date: Available immediately



Summary

A Senior Python Developer based anywhere in Europe is sought by DigitalMR to work on our innovative market research project, listening247®. Aspects of this job include designing, developing, testing, and deploying new cutting edge software solutions to help further advance our web platforms. This is a full time placement with a competitive salary and significant opportunities for innovation, growth, and advancement.



The Company

DigitalMR is an early stage high tech company in the space of market research and marketing. Following 4 years of focussed R&D in A.I. - financed by multiple government grants and self generated cash - we have developed a lot of unique I.P. some of which is patent pending. The main areas of our research are: text analytics - NLP, sentiment & semantic analysis, emotion detection and scoring, automated image theme and sentiment analysis. We work with blue-chip multinationals such as P&G, SABMiller, DIAGEO, Vodafone, Saxo Bank, YPO, Nielsen, TNS, and many more. We are already disrupting a 60 Billion US$ industry.



Requirements:

Having a great fit with the DigitalMR company values
Web development experience in Python, and extensive experience in Javascript will be an advantage
Knowledge of frameworks such as Django or Flask will be an advantage
Prior experience with NoSQL and SQL, and knowledge of Elasticsearch, Cassandra, MongoDB will be an advantage
Record in building modular, reusable, and well-documented code
Working knowledge of the Git version control system and its preferred development workflows
Good organisational skills both in management of time and software code


Good to have:

Good HTML/XHTML/CSS/Javascript skills
Experience with cutting-edge Javascript single-page app frameworks such as React and Angular
Server provisioning and administration in the context of application deployment - experience with tools such as Ansible or Puppet in particular
Experience and/or interest in building a modern SaaS platform, including progress of user onboarding, engagement, analytics.
Experience in building and interfacing with clean REST APIs.
Github account with publicly available code samples.


Roles and Responsibilities:

­Working closely with a dynamic team of software engineers to realise web based platforms


Benefits:

­The successful candidate will have the opportunity to join a fast-growing, agile, and international team passionate about technology and innovation
­Flat structure, no bureaucracy, and lots of autonomy
­A competitive salary + bonus
Working from home

items.title: Senior Full Stack Javascript Developer
items.content:
Opsview is looking for a talented Full Stack Javascript Developer to join our Engineering team to help us revolutionise the Front End of our Product.

Why Opsview?
We are passionately focused on building the best monitoring software on the market. We hire people that are ambitious for success. We like to get things done, with good processes and systems in place, so we can operate efficiently and scale smoothly. We are constantly striving to improve the way we work and have fun along the way!

We are looking for someone with the following experience and expertise:
• Extensive experience of leading the creation of complex web applications using the MEAN stack.
• Extensive knowledge of either Angular 4, React or VueJS.
• Extensive knowledge of NodeJS and Express.
• Experience of integrating web applications with relational databases and NoSQL databases.
• Experience of mentoring Developers.

In return we can offer a competitive salary with great benefits and the option of 50% remote work. We can also offer a relocation package if you would prefer to be in the office with us every day.

It’s really simple at Opsview. We want you to excel in your role and have fun doing it – why not join us?

items.title: Full Time: Paktor - Web Developer at Paktor Pte Ltd in Singapore , remote
items.content:
Company Information:

Paktor was founded with the mission of connecting singles in Asia through technology- enabled platforms. Since its founding in 2013, Paktor Group has expanded beyond Singapore to the rest of Southeast Asia and North Asia, becoming the largest social dating group in the region. The company merged with the Taiwan-based firm to form M17 Entertainment, the leading social entertainment company in the region. Along with its other acquisitions in social dating such as Down, Inc and Goodnight, the group’s social entertainment and dating assets jointly account for over 20 million users in Asia.

Paktor is backed by institutional investors including Vertex Ventures (subsidiary of Temasek), Majuven, Convergence Ventures, Infinity Venture Partners and Yahoo Japan.

Responsibility

Looking to find an experienced frontend web developer who is able to develop a RESTful web based app with Angular and React to connect with our backend. The web app's functionality would be powered by our existing RESTful Web API. For backend we use Java, Firebase and Google Cloud Services.

  • Strong experience with JavaScript Fundamentals.
  • Strong experience with React / Angular.js / Node.js
  • Good projects showcase / Tech Blog / Open Source Contributions
  • Expert at architecting apps for scalability and performance
  • Expert at HTML5, CSS, SASS, Flexbox
  • SQL
  • Experience working in an Agile environment
  • A sense of good UX principles
  • Experience with modern tools: Webpack, Babel, Redux, Docker
  • Experience with Google Cloud Services is a plus.

Bonus points if you have:

  • A BS/MS in Computer Science or Engineering from a top school, but a wonderful project list trumps all
  • Prior start-up experience is awesome (not necessary); being scrappy will help you hit the ground running.
  • At least 2 years of working experience in software development.

items.title: Full Time: Senior Web Engineer at 10up in Remote
items.content:
Responsibilities

-Develop WordPress plugins and/or themes primarily using PHP.
-Leverage WordPress APIs and extend the WordPress admin experience.
-Solve complex problems in simple ways.
-Solve bugs and address client issues in a fast-paced environment.
-Juggle current projects with incoming tasks.
-Respond directly to clients courteously and clearly.
-Solve client challenges with understanding and empathy.
-Test solutions across multiple browsers and platforms in a local testing environment.
-Deploy changes to live servers.
-Assist in the remediation, enhancement, and maintenance of client sites.

Requirements

-Intermediate or expert skills in: PHP, JavaScript, jQuery, WordPress, HTML, CSS.
-Code portfolio. Link us to your GitHub account, upload a .zip, or both.
-Experience using Git or SVN.
-Ability to setup a local environment for testing PHP code (Vagrant usage is a plus!)
-Proficiency in verbal and written English.
-Ability to communicate professionally with technical and non-technical colleagues and clients.

Nice to have

-Computer Science degree.
-Experience working for demanding or enterprise-level clients.
-Evidence of contribution to the broader web development community.
-Remote working experience appreciated.

About 10up

Making Content Management Easy, and Maybe Even Fun

We work with some of the most well-known names in publishing: ESPN, Time Inc, TechCrunch, and TED, as well as other non-profit, government, and enterprise clients. We work on some of the worlds’ largest enterprise WordPress installations and the most complex sites. We create innovative digital experiences that extend the WordPress platform into an enterprise class CMS. We engineer solutions, working with clients to understand their business challenges and marshaling the technology know-how to create sustainable solutions quickly and have immediate impact.

Why work with 10up?

Freedom & Flexibility

We are focused on achieving goals and making things happen, not looking over your shoulder. Break out of “brick and mortar” offices and gain freedom from commutes. Our team works when and where they are most inspired.

Open Source & Community Values

We believe in an open, collaborative Internet and the democratization of publishing – making the tools for building and telling stories simple and affordable. This firm belief translates to reinvesting our time, effort, and money back into the community that we’ve built our business on. We give back by…

-Being involved in the community: 10up employs more WordPress core contributors than any agency in the world
-Contributing to WordPress Core and jQuery
-Open sourcing plugins and utilities and collaborating with existing open source projects
-Sharing our expertise by organizing, speaking at, and attending community events and conferences

Opportunities to Learn & Grow

You’ll be encouraged to learn and grow on every project in any way you can. Read about new technology and techniques, then figure out how to use them to make people’s lives better, easier, or just bring a smile to someone’s face.

What are the benefits?

-Health, dental, and vision insurance
-Flexible work schedule
-Eligibility for 401K participation
-9 paid holidays
-Freedom to work from anywhere
-Potential for WordCamp and other conference sponsorships
-On-site learning summits
-Equipment allowance
-Personal Professional Development Budget
(Benefits vary for those outside of the U.S.)

items.title: Sr. Software Engineer (Remote or Local) - Evanios - Remote
items.content:
Sr. Software Engineer (Remote or Local)
Evanios -Remote

*This position may be located at our Orlando, FL headquarters, or remote . Resume and cover letter are required.

Looking to ramp up your career with a fast growing software company? Check out Evanios!

We build software that automates IT Operations processes for complex organizations. Our product consolidates IT alert/event data, uses machine learning to predict technology failures, and reduce downtime. Used primarily by Fortune 1000 customers, our flagship SaaS application enhances ServiceNow™, a dominant platform for enterprise companies. We’re expanding rapidly, so we’re looking for the right people to join our team.

This isn’t “just another” tech job.

Evanios is red-hot and values-based. We can proudly boast an exceptionally high renewal rate - the most honest measure of customer satisfaction. We exist to blow our customers’ minds, build an environment in which our team members thrive, and revolutionize the industry. To fit in here you’ll need to demonstrate an awesome work ethic, high initiative and a great sense of humor...we work hard, enjoy each other’s company and have a ton of fun.

Your Role

You will build software that changes the industry and blows our customers’ minds. Your ideas and actions will drive our evolution. As an instrumental player on our development team, you will leverage Agile and SCRUM methodologies, lead design teams, and manage the creation and release of new features. An overachieving software guru who applies a laser-sharp focus on user experience, you’ll continuously improve our software with leading edge machine learning capabilities, while leveraging the most scalable, secure architectures available.

Additionally, you will…

  • Improve and extend Evanios software using technologies like JavaScript, Kafka, MySQL, Percona MySQL, OrientDB, AngularJS, Bootstrap, Java, REST, SQL, NoSQL, HTML, and ServiceNow
  • Drive decisions on UI/UX design and usability
  • Oversee product packaging, scalability, and beta tests
  • Perform unit testing for usability and functionality
  • Manage the development of new features by collaborating with other team members
  • Design, document, and work from stories in our Agile/Scrum process
  • Become an expert with the Evanios technology stack (aka: be an Evanios Guru)

Required Skills & Experience:

  • BS or B Tech Degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, related or equivalent foreign degree
  • 5 years experience as Sr. Applications Developer, Sr. Software Engineer, Technical Architect/Project Lead or related
  • Proficiency in JavaScript, Java, and SQL
  • Expertise with Apache Kafka, Percona MySQL, and OrientDB is a plus
  • Familiarity with DevOps methodologies for rapid code deployment
  • Great analytical capacity and proven technical aptitude – you breathe tech, you’re wicked smart and other people say so (They should also say they enjoy working with you…)
  • Applied experience with machine learning, IT automation, and predictive analytics
  • Some experience with IT monitoring tools (things like Nagios, SolarWinds, BMC, DataDog, SCOM, Zabbix, etc.)
  • Ability to quickly get up to speed on the Evanios platform and technologies (hint: a cover letter explaining how you have similar things previously would be a good idea)
  • A strong work ethic and entrepreneurial spirit – for real. We’re not looking for people who wait to be told what to do. We’re a company of go-getters who identify opportunities or problems then create solutions.
  • Good communication skills, both written and verbal. You may be in customer facing situations, so interviewing well through email, over the phone and in person creates an important first impression.

If you like to build things, and really want to see and feel the impact of your work then Evanios might be for you. We offer a competitive salary, generous vacation, medical, dental, and vision benefits, 401k, paid life insurance, career growth opportunity, and a great work environment.

Please note: Your resume and cover letter are both required for consideration. Applications without either component will be disregarded.

Job Type: Full-time

Required education:

  • Bachelor's

Required experience:

  • ServiceNow: 3 years
  • SQL, MySQL, NoSQL: 3 years
  • Application Development: 5 years
  • Javascript: 3 years

Required language:

  • English

items.title: Full Time: Experienced Full Stack Wizard at Convert in Remote
items.content:
Full Time
Any nationality in any location
No visa required
100% Distributed team
Ideal working availability minimum 2-hour overlap with GMT +2 business hours
No agencies or recruiters, please.


Who We Are

We make fast and reliable A/B testing software. This helps our customers improve their clients’ experience and improve their conversions. We’ve got an outstanding support team and we truly care about our product and its impact on this world. This is why we follow our Conscious Business ideology.

Apart from coffee, we’re powered by a fiercely passionate team who believe in our organizational move to Holacracy to grow our business and distribute decision making. Don’t let being distributed over 12 countries fool you, we have a cohesive culture with strong voices. Our members are empowered to make decisions (and mistakes) to drive Convert forward.

We are deeply committed to equality. Equality of location, citizenship, gender, education, timezone, religion, sexual orientation etc.. This means that all applicants who pass step 2 are anonymized. Applicant code names are assigned and any information identifying the above are blacked out. This is our way to ensure that candidates moved to a technical review or interview are based solely on their qualifications and not on our unconscious biases.


What We Want

A Wizard. You’re an experienced, full stack web developer. Things you like: working with web technologies to build cloud-hosted apps, solving problems at scale, fulfilling a critical role in a growing, changing company.

Here, you’ll be kind of a big deal. What you build will directly influence the way our customers interact with our app—and whether they grow to love or hate, Convert software.

Who We Want

You’re principled, self-motivated, resourceful, and driven by new challenges. You integrate (and are up to speed on) security best practices—but you’re also curious about new tech.

Right now, we use PHP, Node.js, Ractive.js, REST/XML, relational and big data databases. But technologies change, and so do we. We’re open to new ideas and embrace more powerful, or more efficient, technologies with open arms. You’re as excited about these opportunities as we are.

What You Know

Valuable experience with the following technologies is a requirement:

  • PHP using an Object-Oriented Programming approach
  • Node.js
  • SOAP
  • XML
  • REST API’s
  • Git as a versioning system
  • JavaScript concepts and design

Your work will touch all components of the web app so we’d love you to have the following skills:

  • Skilled at designing web apps, and/or functionality inside existing web apps, that easily scale horizontally
  • Talent for keeping security and ease of use at the forefront
  • Highly experienced with back-end technologies
  • Adept at designing and building apps/modules that scale
  • Accomplished with modern front-end technologies like Ractive.js
  • Proven experience working with both relational and non-relational databases for large-scale apps

Bonus Points

  • Seasoned in designing and building large scale apps based on elastic-search and/or Splunk logs/events management engine is a real plus

    #What You’ll Get Paid

We have a generous offer for distributed team members based on your location. Check our salary calculator

Perks
  • Reasonable flexibility to choose hours and snooze notifications on Slack
  • A strong team culture of appreciation and support. Seriously
  • Excellent work/life balance, we only work weekends when it's needed
  • Principled. To give you an idea
  • Credit per month for Kindle/Audible
  • Blinkist Subscription
  • Spotify Subscription: Because music can help the work … flow. We often share our playlists as well.

  • Productivity Stipend: You can spend this in any way you see fit to make you more productive: coworking space, home internet upgrade, kindle purchase, better chair, or coffee at the place around the block that has the best wifi!

    What You’ve Got

  • High fluency in written and oral English which is the common language of our international team (we love your beautiful accents)

  • Collaborates with ease, sync and async

  • Excellent active listening approach to problem-solving

  • A very robust personal website and/or online profile with lots of content to show us how savvy you are

    What You’ll Do

  • Be a key team member that handles the maintenance and the evolution of Convert’s A/B testing and personalization web platform whose focus will be mostly on the back-end

  • Help the app to handle hundreds of millions of monthly users and show our customers interesting reporting based on that traffic

  • Creative problem solving when we scale from 500M visitors to 500B visitors

  • Fix things when something goes wrong

  • Become one with the app along the way, as every aspect would be mastered by you

  • Directly influence our customers’ use of our fantastic product

    Your Goals

  • Learn every aspect of the app and be able to resolve any issue that might appear

  • Help to build a petabyte-scalable and extendable reporting engine

    Sound like a fit? Let's talk

items.title: Codivated: Freelance / Contract PHP Developer
items.content:
Part-time

(USA)

Codivated, a web development agency focused on delivering top-notch services to our clients and building world class products, is looking to establish a long-term working relationship with a reliable developer. This is a freelance/contractor position requiring competency in all things PHP.

We are looking for someone to handle 25-40 hours a week of steady remote work at an hourly rate commensurate with your background and experience. Please note that at this time for this position we can only work with U.S. Citizens.

About the work to be done

Our immediate need is for someone to work on a successful SaaS application built with CodeIgniter 3. We are looking to upgrade some existing functionality to be more scalable, integrate more automated tests, and continue to fix bugs as they are discovered.

Besides this project, we also have multiple ongoing WordPress projects involving server to server migrations, custom theme development, and custom plugin development.

What we are expecting from you, professionally:

  • Minimum 1 year of experience with an MVC framework
  • 3+ years experience working with PHP
  • Experience maintaining and/or implementing complex PHP applications
  • Ability to write secure and performant code
  • Thorough knowledge of PHP and MySQL
  • Proficiency with object-oriented programming
  • Experience with automated testing

What we are expecting from you, personally:

  • Strong communication skills
  • Self-motivated and detail-oriented
  • Strong organizational skills
  • Ability to multi-task efficiently
  • Ability to prioritize workloads and meet deadlines
  • Excited to be part of a small growing team
  • Fluent in English

What to include in your application:

Tell us a bit about yourself. Be sure to include your resume, relevant experience, and availability.

We'd also love it if you could answer the following questions in your application:

  1. Have you ever worked on a production system involving queues?
  2. Do you have any experience working with CodeIgniter?
  3. Can you tell us about a difficult engineering problem you were faced with, and how you overcame it?
  4. What's your desired hourly rate?
  5. What kind of availability do you have? (Note: let us know your current working situation. Maybe you're a full-time employee looking for some side work, a freelancer who happens to have availability, or something else.)

We are expecting a lot of applications, so chances are we will not be able to reply to everybody individually. That being said, if you include an answer to each of the above questions, you're guaranteed a response from us.

Thank you for your interest in Codivated!

Job Perks: flexible working schedule, work remotely

Apply: Tell us a bit about yourself. Be sure to include your resume, relevant experience, desired hourly rate, and availability.

items.title: Web Application Developer (MEAN Stack)
items.content:
JOB DESCRIPTION

If you are passionate about technology then this is for you.

We are looking for a part-time and a full-time MEAN stack developer (Interns) to work on our AI platform and various cloud based applications that power it in the backend. We are looking for somebody who is absolutely enthusiastic about technology and has a passion for code.

This is a part-time / full-time paid internship with a high probability of a full-time position upon completion of internship. Growth potential is huge as we are furiously building an A class team. You will be working under the mentorship of some of the most brilliant minds in technology and business.


ABOUT US.

Crossing35.com an Edinburgh based tech start-up that is building an Artificial Intelligence enabled platform to help CEOs tap global markets. At the moment, we are a small team of 6, most of whom are specialist technical and business experts.

The work culture is quite informal but professional. We are currently hot-desking out of CodeBase in Edinburg as we wait for an office space allocation there. We like sitting together and working together as a team, but it is not uncommon for us to work occasionally from home, or meet at our CEOs flat for a brain storming session over beer and pizza (or curry or burger).

We also love playing table-tennis in the middle of our workday.

WORKING HOURS

We normally work together at CodeBase from Mon-Fri (9am -5pm) but are flexible on time and are willing to work around your academic schedule.

SKILLS – MUST HAVE

- Experience with Javascript & styling frameworks (AngularJS, Bootstrap, ReactJS)
- Experience with backend technologies (NodeJS)
- Experience with NoSQL databases e.g. MongoDB.
- Proven ability to rapidly pick up new technologies, frameworks and skills
- Experience with version control systems like GIT

DESIRABLE…

- Agile development methodologies and Continuous Integration, Testing and Deployment.
- Prior experience of developing front-end systems for startups would be a significant bonus.
- Strong collaborative and interpersonal skills;
- The ambition and enthusiasm to drive the company forward
- Knowledge of cloud based technologies like Heroku, AWS and Microsoft Azure.
- Knowledge on other programming languages like python, go, is an added advantage.

items.title: Senior Software Developer – Reputation Team @ Mailgun
items.content:
Senior Software Developer – Reputation Team @ Mailgun

2017-10-13 19:28

Description

Mailgun is hiring a senior software developer to join our reputation team. The team’s mission is to help our customers build a great sending reputation while fighting the bad guys sending SPAM. Empower customers with the tools they need to truly deliver their message! Create state of the art control systems to ensure the best sending infrastructure ever! Our ideal candidate is a full stack engineer with a passion for data science, jack-of-all-trades who can do extensive research and turn the findings into code.

Mailgun has a distributed engineering team and will consider qualified candidates anywhere in the world. We also have engineering offices in San Francisco, Austin, San Antonio, and Nizhny Novgorod (Russia).

Our Team

  • We believe in contributing back to the community. Many of the tools and libraries we’ve developed are open source (https://github.com/mailgun)
  • We move fast and don’t believe in having unnecessary silos and red tape that keep teams from shipping software. As a developer on the team, you are responsible for not only building great software, but ensuring it is operating properly once it’s been deployed.
  • We have a passion for solving hard problems – our services are responsible for processing billions of messages each month and have to not only scale, but be highly reliable.

Responsibilities

  • Create and analyze data streams.
  • Develop machine learning models and incorporate them into existing services.
  • Develop new features to improve the capabilities of the Mailgun offering.
  • Refactor existing Python services leveraging Go and a microservice architecture.
  • Maintain and scale existing infrastructure.
  • Participation in the on-call rotation.

Requirements

  • BS in Computer Science or related area.
  • Education in machine learning, statistics or related, self-taught or e-learning is accepted.
  • 4+ years of a relevant work experience.
  • Experience with machine learning, statistics or related.
  • Experience with distributed systems.
  • Experience building RESTful web services.
  • Experience working with Python and/or Go.

Country

Anywhere

items.title: Senior Django Developer
items.content:
Led by an industry expert with deep product knowledge, Articheck is an angel-funded startup, with a SaaS offering for the art industry that automates the process of checking and recording the condition of artworks. The company is well established within the industry, and has significant traction with high profile museums, galleries and art shippers. We are set to dominate the market and become an industry standard.

We are looking for a senior developer with startup experience. The Articheck platform currently consists of a Django site, together with an iOS client. The main responsibilities of the role would be:

Choosing the right technologies and frameworks to allow the product to scale as the customer base and database of artwork condition reports grows
Plenty of hands-on coding of backend web services and new features
Working with CTO to meet the IT needs of a growing company

The ideal candidate would have the following:

  • Expertise in server side development in Python/Django
  • Experience across the full stack
  • Linux server administration and Amazon AWS experience
  • Proven track record of having lead roles designing and developing web-based applications
  • Belief in the importance of writing clean, readable and maintainable code
  • A self-starter who is comfortable working remotely
  • A confident communicator, both written and verbal
  • Great command of the English language
  • Experience working for a startup company

    At Articheck, we believe in a great work life balance. We are based in London but will consider applicants in other nearby time zones (ie, EST). The salary range is £45,000 - £65,000, depending on experience and equity package selected.

    To apply, please send us your CV, as well as links to any GitHub profiles, blogs, or sites you have developed, etc. No recruiters and no development companies please.

    Due to the number of responses, we will only be contacting individuals that we are considering for the position. Please email: jobs@articheck.com

items.title: Full-Stack Rails Programmer Ã¢Â Â  to Mature and Expand Web Platform
items.content:
Are you prepared to take charge of maturing and expanding an entire web platform? We're looking for an excellent Ruby developer to build out Baymard's custom-built Rails-based web platform.

The Job
In this position, you will have a lot of influence on the technical direction of the company since all Baymard employees are e-commerce UX researchers except one (Jamie, co-founder of the business, and the person you’ll be working most closely together with). It’s an opportunity to help envision and build the technical platform of a research company that, while it works with tech, isn't yet another app or web service. (Because of this we’re also more than happy to open-source our internal code and scripts because we don't make our money from code.)

Requirements
- We're looking for someone with strong programming skills since we want you to take charge / ownership of our tech platform.
- Since all of our current infrastructure is written in Ruby, it's a major plus if that's your choice of language too.
- Familiarity with JavaScript and CSS are a bonus, but not required.

Note: you must be fluent in English, comfortable working remotely via digital platforms and willing to do a few yearly travels for team meetups (expect 2-4 weeks of travel each year).

Are We A Good Fit?
If you’re looking for a chance to work on long-term goals rather than chasing monthly user growth targets, this will be a good match. We’re a business that has been profitable from day one and we really don’t care about temporarily spiking our user metrics in order to flip the company or impress VC investors. We’re much more interested in steady and sustainable improvements to our business – continually increasing the value we deliver to our customers (from which sustained increases in profitability organically follow). Since all of Baymard’s research is delivered through its website, your work will have an immediate and tangible impact on the company.

We want to work with the smartest and most dedicated people around the world, and all of our positions are therefore open to full-time remote work. In other words, you are welcome to work with us from any location you prefer (which many of our employees do). If you want to, you’re of course also welcome to work in our Copenhagen-based office.

About Baymard
Baymard Institute is a small independent web usability research organization, specialized in conducting large-scale generic usability studies of e-commerce sites. These studies are published as industry reports and benchmark databases at baymard.com (this site is a big part of the web platform you’ll be working on) – which is being used by thousands of web professionals, all the way from the independent freelance web designer to the UX Director of a Fortune 500 company.

You'll be working with a team of dedicated usability researchers conducting cutting-edge e-commerce research used by UX teams at some of the biggest brands in the world (clients include Nike, Lenovo, Etsy, etc.)?

Apply
If you’re interested in this position, please send the following to jamie+job@baymard.com (listed in order of importance):

- Samples of back-end code you’ve written.
- Samples of front-end code you’ve written (optional).
- Other information you find relevant (hobbies, interests, work experience, CV, ..).

Note: All applications and materials are kept strictly confidential. That said, open-source contributions are perfectly fine as code samples too – just send along / point us towards whatever “work” you feel best represents your skills.

items.title: Front-end Web Developer (HTML & CSS Specialist)
items.content:
MyFutureNow is a pension tracing and consolidation service that locates workplace and personal pensions that have been lost or disconnected from the policyholder. Users of our service can also consolidate the pensions that we trace, to make their pension pot easier to manage and give them a better return when they retire.

We are looking for an experienced front-end web developer, to help us develop new customer-led features, and to improve our current service both functionally and visually.

We need someone who is smart, organised, motivated and gets things done. Someone who wants to work in a startup environment and likes the idea of doing a bit of everything and taking ownership of what they work on. Someone with ideas about everything, isn’t afraid to argue their point (while respecting everyone else’s of course) and is constantly thinking “How can we do this better?”.

Who you are:

* You have at least 2 years of commercial experience working as a front-end developer.
* You have excellent HTML, CSS (and "plain-old" Javascript) coding skills, with the ability to produce responsive, cross-browser, interactive web pages.
* Your interest in development extends past coding; you have a passion for products and a perspective on user experience and product design.
* An independent streak is essential – although you will work closely with other members of our team, you will be required at times to drive work forward without being spoon-fed.
* Ideally you have already worked within a development team using web frameworks such as Ruby-on-Rails or Elixir-Phoenix, as you will be assisting our back-end development team with the integration of your front-end code with the rest of the application.
* **Note:** We are _not currently_ looking for a pure "Javascript Framework" developer (e.g. Angular.js, ReactJS experience is not required), we are looking for a HTML and CSS specialist who can work turn designs and prototypes into working web-pages. However, any exposure to these technologies would be useful to help with scoping future application requirements.

What you’ll do:

* Collaborate closely with our UX designers, strategists, CTO and back-end developers, to turn ideas into working features.
* Develop our products and services across web, mobile, and other touch devices (HTML web application, native mobile not required)
* Work using “Source Control” (i.e. Github) and “Pull Requests” to ensure a high level of quality in your code and an excellent end product for our customers.
* Use Agile techniques to iteratively ship products in a small, self-organised team.

How to apply:

* This position will be based in our Dublin office, but regular visits to our London and Bristol offices will are required. Some remote working may be possible, but we are not looking for fully-remote developers.
* If you have done any open-source work, links (e.g. Github projects) would be welcome. However, we recognise that not all companies allow such work, and absence of this will not be counted against your application.
* This is a permanent, salaried position. Salary will based on experience.
* No recruitment companies please.

items.title: Network Programmer
items.content:
The position is with IKA. You will be a part of the creation of a first-ever VR/AR World of Science and Technology experience; a collaborative Virtual and Augmented Reality gaming platform between industry leading scientists and universities for one of the world’s biggest industries. If you are interested in pushing the boundaries of VR and AR through Science and Technology with a gamification element, this may be the opportunity for you!

We are seeking a full-time Network Programmer (100% remote) to join our dedicated team. We need your expertise in creating fun and engaging multiplayer systems to thrill a whole new audience of scientists. We believe that VR and AR are the future of scientific research and education and would like you to be a part of our future.

The IKA laboratory, as well as the analytical and processing divisions, currently have around 900 employees, and continue to offer a wide range of innovative equipment for numerous applications in research and development, as they have over 100 years. Worldwide market leaders trust in our proven technology.

Responsibilities:

Implement solutions to synchronize gameplay
Analyze and optimize bandwidth usage and latency effects
Develop highly scalable, secure and available connectivity services
Create clear documentation to transfer knowledge and simplify maintenance
Cooperate closely with our gameplay programmers to ensure multiplayer compatibility
Recognize opportunities to improve our application or general workflows, and seek to make these changes

Required Qualifications and Skills:

3+ years of C/C++ experience
2+ years of experience in client-server programming, ideally related to video games
Experience in IP network protocols (TCP and UDP)
Experience in database development (MySQL, Oracle, ... )
Experience with replication, arbitration, bandwidth, load balancing and multiplayer concepts
Experience with 3D game engines
Self-sufficiency
BS (or higher) in Computer Science or a similar discipline (i.e. Physics, Math, EE, etc.)
Strong verbal and written communication skills in English

Desirable Qualifications and Skills:

Unreal Engine experience
Experience in implementing VoIP
Shipped console/PC title experience
VR and/or AR experience as a developer or user
Familiar with: JSON, XML, JavaScript, and/or Python

Benefits and Pay/Additional information:
Comprehensive benefits package for employee and family
Equity offered for the VR/AR division
Competitive compensation
Relocation and visa/immigration support will be provided by the company for the employee and their family
The company is located close to France, Switzerland, the Black Forest, and the Alps for those who like to travel or do outdoor activities on weekends
All office communications are in English

contact: monika.michalak@ika.de

items.title: Senior Software Developer @ Medic Mobile
items.content:
Senior Software Developer @ Medic Mobile

2017-10-12 15:31

Description

Medic Mobile is growing! We're seeking talented, dedicated, and passionate senior developers to join our remote software development team. We are looking for candidates that can be full-stack web developers, with at least one new team member with extensive front-end experience. The dev team is part of our multidisciplinary product team that designs, tests, and builds mobile and web tools for health workers in some of the hardest-to-reach areas in the world.

At Medic, creative solutions to complex problems are the norm. We work in environments with extreme constraints and are inspired by how technology can bridge gaps and reinvent workflows. We’re also a team of realists and shape our tools based on what is most useful and sustainable for our users and partners. Some of our users have never used a touchscreen before; others have several of their own devices. Many of our users work in low-connectivity environments. Our developers help build tools to improve lives by making sure health workers feel supported, informed, and connected to their peers, managers, and patients.

You:

  • Are an experienced developer comfortable forging ahead independently and collaborating effectively with a remote team across many time zones.
  • Can communicate effectively in English over video and text chats as part of a results-focused distributed team.
  • Have developed, deployed, and maintained production web applications.
  • Are productive in a UNIX-like environment: you can script your way out trouble, and build software you need from source code if necessary.
  • Are excited to work with asynchronous JavaScript in the browser and in Node.
  • Understand the basics of database systems, and can become proficient with any one of a wide variety of them without too much trouble.
  • Are capable of picking up front-end JS frameworks, such as AngularJS, ReactJS, even better if you are already a master with one of them.
  • Are well-versed in CSS, HTML and Javascript, as well as mobile responsive web development.
  • Enjoy working closely with and learning from designers to iterate upon solutions and solve problems together.
  • Are interested in understanding and serving our end users.
  • Have a reliable and fast internet connection and a quiet place to collaborate with remote team members.

We:

  • Design and build world-class software deployed at scale to support health workers in their efforts to save lives in the last mile of healthcare.
  • Have a fast-paced, impact-driven culture. We feel the urgency to deliver tools now. We’re constantly improving because health workers deserve world-class tools with an awesome user experience.
  • Are looking to add several developers to our team, including one with a passion for UX and experience with contemporary front-end development standards.
  • Are a family of teammates – project managers, designers, developers, technical leads, and partnership specialists – with offices in San Francisco, Nairobi, Kathmandu, and remote teammates in more than 11 time zones. We believe in collective success and have a culture of pitching in where needed, even if it’s outside our job description.
  • Are passionate about open source software development and open standards. Our tools are primarily built using web technologies. Check out this overview for more details.
  • Work with a variety of governments, health ministries, non-governmental organizations (NGOs), partner organizations, and otherwise awesome people located around the world.

Position Details

The Senior Web Developer reports directly to Medic Mobile’s Chief Technology Officer, and is responsible for the full development life-cycle of Medic Mobile’s web-based mobile health software.

Software Development: 85%

  • Design, build, document, and ship software that improves healthcare outcomes in the developing world.
  • Work with Medic Mobile and its clients along the entire software development life-cycle: understand client problems, capture requirements, design modular software systems, write great software, and document everything along the way.
  • Participate in daily stand-up meetings, weekly iteration reviews, and monthly milestone reviews.
  • Learn new languages, platforms, toolkits, libraries, tools, and application development paradigms as necessary.
  • Contribute directly to open-source and free software projects as appropriate.

Strategic Planning: 5%

  • Work with the CTO and development team to guide platform development and technical strategy.
  • Evaluate tools and technologies; develop long-term software and platform roadmaps.

Team Support: 10%

  • Consult on technical needs for larger-scale deployments, including local hosting, SMS aggregators, app scalability, etc.
  • Work collaboratively with designers to turn user insights into new features and interfaces that help empower our users.
  • Work with the design team to provide input on UI and UX design strategy and best practices.
  • Review and provide feedback on mockups for proposed UX/UI improvements.
  • Work with regional tech leads in Africa and Asia on configuration of Medic’s toolkit as needed.
  • Provide remote troubleshooting support to active deployments as needed.

About Medic Mobile

Operating as a unique, nonprofit technology company, Medic Mobile develops free and open-source tools that support various health program areas. Health workers currently use Medic Mobile to register every pregnancy in their community, ensure that infants are immunized against illnesses, track disease outbreaks faster, keep stock of essential medicines, and communicate about emergencies. Our workflows and tools are designed through a human-centered process and we study our impact to determine what scales. Medic Mobile has worked with over 60 partners across 23 countries in Africa, Asia, Latin America, and the US. Based in San Francisco with regional offices in Africa and Asia, our technology supports over 16,000 frontline health workers, improving health systems for over 11 million people.

If this sounds like a role you'd like to take on, send an email to jobs@medicmobile.org with "Senior Software Developer" as the subject. Please include your resume and a cover letter letting us know why you'd be a good fit at Medic Mobile.

Country

Anywhere

We believe in collective success and have a culture of pitching in where needed, even if it’s outside our job description.
  • Are passionate about open source software development and open standards. Our tools are primarily built using web technologies. Check out this overview for more details.
  • Work with a variety of governments, health ministries, non-governmental organizations (NGOs), partner organizations, and otherwise awesome people located around the world.

    The Senior Web Developer reports directly to Medic Mobile’s Chief Technology Officer, and is responsible for the full development life-cycle of Medic Mobile’s web-based mobile health software.

    Software Development: 85%

  • Design, build, document, and ship software that improves healthcare outcomes in the developing world.
  • Work with Medic Mobile and its clients along the entire software development life-cycle: understand client problems, capture requirements, design modular software systems, write great software, and document everything along the way.
  • Participate in daily stand-up meetings, weekly iteration reviews, and monthly milestone reviews.
  • Learn new languages, platforms, toolkits, libraries, tools, and application development paradigms as necessary.
  • Contribute directly to open-source and free software projects as appropriate.

    Strategic Planning: 5%

  • Work with the CTO and development team to guide platform development and technical strategy.
  • Evaluate tools and technologies; develop long-term software and platform roadmaps.

    Team Support: 10%

  • Consult on technical needs for larger-scale deployments, including local hosting, SMS aggregators, app scalability, etc.
  • Work collaboratively with designers to turn user insights into new features and interfaces that help empower our users.
  • Work with the design team to provide input on UI and UX design strategy and best practices.
  • Review and provide feedback on mockups for proposed UX/UI improvements.
  • Work with regional tech leads in Africa and Asia on configuration of Medic’s toolkit as needed.
  • Provide remote troubleshooting support to active deployments as needed.

    Operating as a unique, nonprofit technology company, Medic Mobile develops free and open-source tools that support various health program areas. Health workers currently use Medic Mobile to register every pregnancy in their community, ensure that infants are immunized against illnesses, track disease outbreaks faster, keep stock of essential medicines, and communicate about emergencies. Our workflows and tools are designed through a human-centered process and we study our impact to determine what scales. Medic Mobile has worked with over 60 partners across 23 countries in Africa, Asia, Latin America, and the US. Based in San Francisco with regional offices in Africa and Asia, our technology supports over 16,000 frontline health workers, improving health systems for over 11 million people.

    If this sounds like a role you'd like to take on, send an email to jobs@medicmobile.org with "Senior Software Developer" as the subject. Please include your resume and a cover letter letting us know why you'd be a good fit at Medic Mobile.

items.title: Back-end Developer - GatherContent Ltd - (Remote anywhere in the UK) - FullTime
items.content:
• GatherContent Ltd (Remote anywhere in the UK)
  • Fulltime Job

    • Back-end Developer

    About GatherContent

    GatherContent is a SaaS platform which helps teams organise and produce lots of content for websites. The platform enhances content development workflow, saving our customers time and money.

    We launched in 2012 and have bootstrapped our way to profitability.

    GatherContent is used by thousands of customers all over the world including Intel, Ogilvy, JWT, Spotify and Harvard University.

    GatherContent has a small office presence in London but we are remote by default. The team works from up and down the UK.

    The Role

    We’re looking for an experienced, UK-based Back-end Developer who wants to be part of a remote-working, fast growing startup (we’ve been around for a few years). You will be working as part of our Agile, 8 person team to help deliver iterations to our product.

    • Start date: as soon as possible
    • Pay: £40,000 per/annum (Plus benefits)
    • Full-time role
    • Based anywhere in UK. Remote or on-site (we have an office in London and offer budget for co-working spaces or to support your home office)

    Please be aware that although the position is remote, we will need you to travel to London during the interview process, and attend a team day (usually in London) every four months.

    What we need

    • Your undivided passion, energy, focus and enthusiasm for both the role and our business.
    • A self-starter attitude with experience managing and prioritising your own workload.
    • An ability to get things done quickly (whilst maintaining quality); working to a pace.
    • A team-player who works as well with others as well as individually.
    • Strong opinions, loosely held – you have no fear when it comes to contributing ideas and participating in discussions with the team. You’re also happy to take critique, self-improve and move forward fast.
    • Innovation – you need to be open and willing to adopt new ways of working. Our processes are constantly evolving and we always look to take a lean approach.
    • Customer focus – You should always be thinking, “What can I be doing to deliver the most value to our customers?”
    • Leave your ego at the door. We make decisions based on what’s right for the company, no exceptions.
    • Integrity- you do the right thing and know how to set expectations
    • Direct feedback- you’re comfortable giving and receiving feedback
    • Continuous improvement- you’re always looking for ways to better yourself and company processes
    • Wellness- you live a balanced routine and avoid heroism or burnout

    The skills we’re looking for are

    • Attention to Software Design and System Architecture
    • Experience with Object Orientated PHP and SOLID principles
    • Laravel 5
    • Coding standards (PSR2)
    • Composer dependancy management tool
    • Domain Modelling
    • Test Driven Development
    • Continuous Integration and Delivery
    • Agile Development Principles

    Bonus points for experience with

    • Working remotely
    • Working in a startup environment (especially on a saas product)
    • Knowledge of content management systems
    • Real time web applications
    • Experience with other parts of our stack (Node.js, React)
    • Virtual machines (Vagrant, Chef)

    What we can offer you

    • Remote working: work from anywhere within the UK (so long as there’s decent WIFI!)
    • Family friendly: family always comes first, supported by our flexible outlook
    • Work/life balance: we work a 35 hour week and encourage downtime and a healthy lifestyle. It’s about quality over quantity (one of our values is wellness!)
    • 32 days annual leave
    • The chance to make a real impact on our business: We’re a small team of 18 so there’s a huge opportunity for everyone to contribute, collaborate and make their mark.
    • Fun times: We get together at the London office every four months for a team day. Past activities have varied from anything like volunteering on a city farm to doing a 3D printing workshop or just making lots of chocolate truffles :)
    • Competitive salary, stock options, pension and other benefits such as remote working budget and a budget for conferences, books and online learning resources.

    You also need to include the word ‘asparagus’ in your cover letter to show that you’ve read the job role (this helps us weed out time wasters!)

    Closing date: 31 December 2017

    We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status or disability status.

    How to apply

    https://gathercontent.workable.com/jobs/585506

items.title: Tech Lead - Mobile Development iOS and/or Android (Remote) - Dogfish Mobile - London
items.content:
Tech Lead - Mobile Development iOS and/or Android (Remote)
Dogfish Mobile -London

Our passion is how technology can make a difference in the world and we thrive on delivering projects with real purpose. Dogfish Mobile is a global digital company that solves complex business problems by creating mobile and digital solutions, which improve people’s lives.

If you love technology, thrive in a team-based culture where you have a lot of fun along the way and have a willingness to learn new things, then Dogfish Mobile could be the place for you.

Job Summary

We are looking for a Tech Lead to join our team. At Dogfish Mobile we work with a wide variety of clients from a number of different sectors, including Financial Services, Retail, Heath & Social Care and Travel/Leisure. We work at the cutting edge of technology and help our clients realise their ambitions by utilising that technology. The successful candidate will play a critical part in the Dogfish Mobile Senior Development team.

Responsibilities and Duties

As Tech Lead at Dogfish Mobile, you will be responsible for leading a team of mobile based application developers through the full life cycle of complex project, as well as;

  • Manage a team of mobile application developers through the full life cycle of complex projects
  • Manage multiple projects simultaneously within established time constraints
  • Manage consultants and less experienced mobile application developers
  • Lead architectural discussions and draw consensus among multiple stakeholders
  • Design and develop reusable code based on company standards and best practices
  • Work with our Project Managers to review requirements and input into technical acceptance criteria to ensure that clients expectations are met and that project schedules are adhered to
  • Construct architectural designs for new functionality as well as for migration of legacy technology
  • Work with QA to review test cases and automated test plans
  • Responsible for the quality and completeness of detailed technical specifications, solution designs, and code reviews as well as adherence to non-functional requirements
  • Scale and propose solutions meeting client’s goals and budget
  • Input into project costings and estimations for clients.

Technical Competencies, Education, Training & Experience

  • Bachelor’s degree in related field (Bachelor of Science in Computer Science) coupled with relevant experience
  • Solid understanding of the full mobile software development life cycle
  • Mobile development experience using Swift, Java and/or Kotlin
  • Knowledge of React Native would be an advantage
  • Experience managing, mentoring and training other developers
  • Strong understanding of Android and iOS UI guidelines
  • Web development an advantage using node.js or PHP.
  • Experience coding style sheets for responsive design
  • Experience with Agile, Test Driven Development
  • Knowledge of security standards and techniques for mobile applications
  • Understand browser-specific compatibility issues on web projects
  • Experience leading a team of multiple developers.

Key Relationships

  • Client
  • Senior Management
  • Project Management team
  • Software Development team
  • UI & UX Design team

The role can be offered as remote (work from home) with some travel required for the right candidate.

Dogfish Mobile can offer you a competitive salary and benefits package.

Job Type: Full-time

items.title: [Remote] SEO Specialist
items.content:
Hi! We are searching for a part-time SEO Specialist for our growing agency. From this position, you will work remotely within our Digital PR and SEO specialists, supporting our ongoing client campaigns with both on-site and off-site SEO-related tasks.

The right person for this role has a thorough understanding of technical SEO, but frames it within a larger understanding of online marketing strategies. In addition, as an agency we are very focused on people being self motivated, capable of taking personal responsibility and working autonomously, to produce great results.

What You Will Be Doing:
* Perform technical SEO audits
* Perform title tag optimization, internal link structuring, meta tag optimization and conversion optimization
* Create highly refined SEO strategies that lay the foundation for the rest of a client's SEO project
* Perform thorough, detailed website analysis, identifying current problems and opportunities, with a focus on crawlability, site architecture and site content
* Perform competitive research, identifying what the client's competitors are doing right, what they're doing wrong, and how these tactics influence the rankings
* Work on off site strategies that will drive brand awareness, create relevance and reach the right target
* Identify and manage crawl errors, sitemaps, site speed issues, and any other technical issues that can affect ranking.
* Report regularly on SEO KPIs, including Ranking, Traffic, CTR, Conversion, and CPA.

Key skills required:
* 4+ years of SEO-related experience
* Extensive experience with SEO-related tools, including SEMRush, Google Analytics, Google Webmaster Tools, etc.
* Expertise in technical aspects of SEO; strong working knowledge of how HTML, Javascript, CSS and site architecture impact search rankings
* Proactive, can-do approach to problem-solving
* Strong attention to detail
* Excellent time management skills and a commitment to on time deliverables
* A high sense of autonomy and responsibility
* Constantly staying up to date on current industry practices, news, and algorithm updates


Benefits:
* Work wherever and however you like - we just care you deliver great results!
* Flexible working hours
* Supportive learning environment
* Regular coaching

Are you interested in finding out more?

Please apply with your CV and LinkedIn profile and any other website/profile that could tell us more about you, mentioning why did you decide to apply for this position and your interest to join our team.

items.title: Doist: Back-end Engineer (Python)
items.content:
Full-time

(Remote)

At Doist, we strive to build not only amazing products but amazing groups of people. Our multidisciplinary teams are passionate about creating products like Todoist and Twist that improve people’s lives. They thrive on innovating new solutions to old productivity challenges and seek to change how productivity tools are made.

Doist is a global, remote-first company and we believe that our way of working– independent of borders and time zones– is the future. As part of our web team, you’ll play a key role in helping us inspire the workplace of the future.

Your role 

We’re searching for an engineer who will join our back-end team. The ideal candidate is a solid Python developer with a deep understanding of Internet technologies, experience in designing APIs, a strong engineering intuition, and good communication skills. In this role, you’ll help us improve Todoist by adding useful, innovative features and you’ll work to make the service faster, more stable, and more convenient. It’s a challenging task since Todoist is constantly evolving and is available on 10+ platforms with over 50 partners integrations which continue to grow weekly.

You’ll collaborate closely between Todoist’s development team, partner companies, and independent developers to turn Todoist into a true productivity hub.

As a back-end Python engineer you'll:

  • Contribute code to multiple projects and initiatives that make our back-end better
  • Propose, design, develop, and deploy new features
  • Assume a role in planning the evolution of Todoist API, adding new features and optimizing the code.
  • Build more language SDKs for our API Design and build integrations between Todoist and third-party platforms
  • Be a responsible team member: do code reviews, mentor others, refactor code, share knowledge

The ideal candidate will have:

  • 3+ years of professional experience developing for the web
  • Expert level knowledge of Python
  • A background in designing and refactoring large-scale systems
  • Experience with Git and GitHub
  • Fluency in written and spoken English
  • Proven ability to work autonomously and stay self-motivated, or previous experience working in remote teams

We’re bootstrapped, profitable, and committed to building a sustainable company that will continue to grow for decades to come. That means we value work-life balance and invest in our employees’ long-term growth.

We offer:

  • Competitive compensation
  • Generous paid vacation + national holidays
  • Education stipends
  • Flexible schedule and location
  • Home office perks
  • And much more

This is a remote position, so you will be free to work from wherever you please on whatever schedule works best for you. You’ll also have the option to work from our offices in Porto, Portugal, Barcelona, Spain, or rent a co-working space in the city where you live. 

We invite you to learn more about how we work on Doist’s Ambition & Balance blog. 

Apply:

items.title: Software Engineer (part time/full time)
items.content:
NO AGENCIES

We are looking for someone to join our Engineering team who is able to take initiative and work independently. Our office is in Old Street, London, though we will be moving to Vauxhall next year.

As a relatively small company, we have an entrepreneurial culture and tend to work very fast. You will be expected to contribute in our daily scrum and quality assurance processes. You will not be working on resolving tickets. We want you to hear your ideas and you to code product solutions.

Desired characteristics:

We prefer those we can work in the office rather than remote (exceptions made on a case by case basis)

Expected time commitment 8 to 40 hours a week, based on agreed contract.

Experience with programming in Python

Very good knowledge of Django, JavaScript, PostgreSQL

Experience with Git or Mercurial version control systems

Unix-like operating system as the primary work environment

Excellent English or German

Ability to solve technical problems independently

Effective communication with clients and teammate

Able to prioritise and have a ‘get things done’ attitude

Can work remotely on occasion but prefer someone to work in the office with our team

Send an email to jobs@reio.co and state your interest in the subject 'Software Engineer'. This is very important as the inbox has rules setup to filter.

No agencies please, only direct applicants.

items.title: Surge IO Inc: Senior Backend Engineer (PHP)
items.content:
Full-time

(Anywhere)

About us:

Surge is a publisher focused platform building the future of analytics, demand and content optimization. We've focused heavily on our product (you won't find much about us publicly, all of our clients are word-of-mouth). We have no public web presence. We work exclusively with publishers doing at least 50 million page views every month. Our largest customer is an Alexa top 50 site. We give our clients the ability to view every single ad impression served on their site and tie it back to the exact amount of revenue it generated along with the content that the user was viewing and the user that the ad impression was delivered to. Every single one of our customers is important to us, and we provide an extremely high level of service, continually going above and beyond. We're a small team that's 100% remote.

About you/the role:
We're looking for an exceptional full-stack developer to grow our engineering team. Our stack is modern PHP + VueJS + Vanilla JS. We're looking to move a portion of our code to typescript - so familiarity with typescript would be a huge plus. You'll be developing code that is deployed to some of the largest websites in the world on the analytics side, as well as code that processes billions of events daily.


Requirements:

  • 3+ years experience working with PHP, comfortable working with modern PHP.
  • Strong SQL skills.
  • Excellent communication skills
  • Ability to evaluate technologies and use the right tool for the job.
  • Comfortable dealing with scaling - benchmarking and optimization, down to the allocator level sometimes (tcmalloc vs jemalloc?).
  • Comfortable working with a 100% remote team - with distributed code reviews.
  • Familiarity with redis, nginx and docker.
  • Self-directed, self-motivated. Must be able to take a feature from idea to production: architecting for scale, documenting, testing and deploying (although your code will go through multiple reviews before making it out into production).
  • Fluent in English (both written and spoken).
  • Comfortable diving into a complex existing code base and getting up to speed quickly.

Pluses:

  • Frontend experience - vanilla JS, VueJS, Typescript.
  • Experience with Facebook's graph API (ad management, specifically).
  • Working with extremely large datasets
  • Familiarity with the web-publishing industry and ecosystem
  • Experience with lua (w/ openresty).
  • Experience with k8s.
  • Any UI/UX experience.
  • Any adtech experience (RTB/implementing HB systems/optimizing).
  • Any devops experience.

We don't care about formal education. All communication is generally through slack, although we do jump on calls from time to time. You must appreciate a no-bullshit office environment. This is a contract to hire position. The first 8-12 weeks will be on contract, transitioning to full time after evaluating fit at the end of that period.

Job Perks: Work remotely with a 100% remote team. Have a strong impact on product direction (small team). Competitive salary, lots of opportunity for growth.

Apply:

items.title: Full Time: Sr. .Net Developer- REMOTE OPPORTUNITY at APEX Analytix in Remote
items.content:
About Us:

APEX Analytix is the first to bring Cognitive Technology, including IBM Watson®, to the apexportal and AP Recovery Audit industry to drive smarter recoveries, controls, analytics, and working capital. We serve Global 1000 clients on 6 continents, in virtually every country in the world, safeguard $2.6 trillion in disbursements each year, and are fluent in languages covering 98% of global trade. Our apexportal Solutions leverage our massive proprietary database of scored supplier records to recover and prevent overpayments, improve processes, ensure compliant supplier relationships, and optimize working capital.

A snapshot of what you would do:

We are seeking a Sr. .Net Application Developer to work collaboratively with a highly talented cross-functional team to create best-in-class solutions for our clients. The ideal candidate thrives in an agile environment and has a passion for developing high-quality, maintainable code for internal and external facing products written in Microsoft's .Net Framework. You will design, develop, and support new functionality in applications written in ASP.Net/C# using .NET Core and MVC5 that make use of SQL Server including stored procedures and SQL Reporting Services. Experience with Microsoft’s SQL Server 2012 or later is a must. You will work on a team of developers with similar complimentary skills and will be required to meet deadlines while delivering quality code.

APEX Culture:

Our culture drives everything! We live our culture of performance, respect, candor and fun—in that order. Performance is measured by delivering value to our clients, generating goodwill, trust and partnership. Sincere respect for each other, our diverse backgrounds and our well-being are our cornerstones. We value open and honest relationships with each other, our clients and our communities. And, life is too short to not have fun! We look for team players who possess the qualities of being humble, hungry, and smart. We recruit candidates who will strive for accountability in performance and career growth, serving fortune 1000 clients in long-term respectful relationships, and working in a diverse and caring environment.

Perks:

We owe our growing success to our team of bright, passionate, and innovative individuals. We truly value our associates and strive to provide the highest quality benefits program offering competitive compensation packages with tailored bonus plans and generous benefits. Our benefits include: health plans (medical, dental, optical, life insurance, disability insurance, FSA, HSA employee assistance program, supplemental insurance options and pre-paid legal), generous paid time off plan, 401k plan, flexible work schedules, wellness programs (company fitness and weight loss challenges, financial wellness software tool, and gym membership stipend), associate and customer referral bonus programs, and paid community hours. And here at APEX, you won’t get lost in the shuffle. Our focus on internal training, growth and development, results in over a quarter of our open positions, filled with internal promotions annually! With resources such as a strong Mentor Program, Internal Training Portal, Education, Tuition, and Certification Assistance, we provide the tools for our associates to grow and develop. If you are looking for a place to shine, come join the team!

Required Skills:
.Net (C#, VB.Net, etc.) (Must)Ability to develop and maintain SQL queries, and stored procedures. (Must)Prior experience and usage of ADO Entities (Must)Deep Winforms Knowledge (Must)WPF Experience (Must)MVP or MVC Frameworks (Must)TFS (Team Foundation System) (Must)WCF and WF (Workflow) Nice to HaveStrong OO fundamentals and expertiseDevelopment of REST and WCF services. Ability to write queries using Linq and Entity Framework 6.0 or later Unit, Integration, and Systems Testing of components.Ability to juggle multiple projects and course correct as business drivers changeStrong communication with team to identify road blocks

Required Experience:
Four-year college degree in Computer Science, IT, Engineering, or related discipline or equivalent experience5+ years of experience in .Net Development (5 years C#)2+ years of experience in application, database and middle tier component designExperience developing applications on Windows Server environmentsExperience working with Agile Development methodologies

Equal Opportunity Employer Women/Minorities/Veterans/Disabilities

items.title: Web Developer - PHP - GIMO - London
items.content:
Web Developer - PHP
GIMO -London
We are looking for a PHP Developer responsible for managing back-end services and ensuring high performance and responsiveness to requests from the front-end. You will also be responsible for integrating the front-end elements built by your co-workers into the application. Therefore, an understanding of front-end technologies is necessary as well.

The ideal developer will be experienced in back-end integrations, SOAP and REST APIs with a problem solving and methodical approach. You will be passionate about back-end development and have great knowledge of different frameworks.

The candidate will work within a team of 7 people for our client, including project management, product owner and development team.
Key SkillsYou must have extensive knowledge and experience of:
  • Ideally an academic background in Computer Science or related discipline
  • Solid grasp of Object Oriented Programming in PHP 5 (5.6+)
  • Experience writing MySQL queries, including advanced filtering, joining, grouping, and sorting
  • Solid experience with version control (Git), GitFlow - Solid experience with SOAP WebServices
  • OO methodologies
  • REST, SOAP APIs
  • Solid grasp of HTML5/CSS3 & Javascript (AngularJS)
  • Used to work in a fast paced web development environment
  • Ability to provide accurate development estimates
  • Good communication skills
  • Excellent team player
PHP developer desirable (not essential):
  • Working with remote teams
  • Node.js
  • API integration in between different technologies (C, Java, PHP)

GIMO -London

items.title: Scala Software Engineer - Crossover - Remote
items.content:
Scala Software Engineer
Crossover -Remote
$15 an hour
Scala Software Engineer

Are you one of top Software Engineers in the world? Do enjoy solving the incredibly complex problems that no one else has been able to complete? Are you 2x more productive than the typical developer? Are you interested in earning $30,000 USD while working for the best companies from the comfort of your home? Eager to join a network of the most talented remote workers in the world? If so, this role is for you.

The Company:

Aurea is the software behind some of the world’s greatest companies, from British Airways in the sky to Disney World on the ground. Aurea and its affiliate companies offer dozens of software solutions that help our clients be more efficient and successful. Aurea is particularly adept at acquiring underperforming software companies and “fixing” them – rapidly reinventing and modernizing the products and investing in customer success.

Aurea is partnering with Crossover to fill this position. Crossover specializes in finding and managing the talent in today’s global workforce and will help you through the recruiting process.

Job Description:

At Crossover you will play a dynamic leadership role in our fast-paced environment. You will be responsible for developing solutions to complex problems, designing and delivering real enterprise-class software products to customers and being a hands-on peer leader of top development resources.
  • Willingness to embrace the concept of iterative development as the means for building seamless products

  • Readiness to give all the effort necessary to do an excellent job - even if it means putting in extra time to research the problem you’re facing

  • Perfectionism: knowing how a job should be done and not stop until it’s done correctly

Required Skills and Experience:
  • Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or Electrical Engineering

  • Proven technical leadership skills with 2+ years of experience of development

  • 2+ years demonstrated experience designing and building large-scale, high-traffic & enterprise level Scala and Java applications.

  • Has worked with back end technologies based on both Scala, JEE and latest frameworks like Spring.

  • Experience in developing applications using various AWS Services

  • Good understanding of OO programming and design patterns.

  • Experience with structured logging with distributed commit logs such as Kafka

  • Experience with one or more of the following Data store types: Nosql DB, Graph DB, Relational DB, Elasticsearch

  • Experience with continuous Integration/ Continuous Delivery (e.g. Jenkins, Build Bot, Travis, etc.)

  • Experience with modern DevOps tools and workflows such as Docker, Git, GitHub, Jira, Phabricator, Jenkins, CircleCI or equivalents

  • Experience with automated build tools like slot, Gradle or Maven

  • Experience with Node.js and AngularJS

Total compensation:$15/hr for 40 productive hours per week

Location:Global (remote)

We’re one of the few legitimate companies offering high-paying jobs that are 100% remote, work from home. You never have to fight traffic to the office again and you have the freedom to choose when and where you put in your 40 hours to be most effective each week.

To qualify, please provide a resume/CV demonstrating the required experience and skills. From there, to help us find the top 1% of talent, there will be a series of interviews and online examinations. We realize these are challenging and can require a decent amount of time so we thank you in advance for your efforts.
