From there, to help us find the top 1% of talent, there will be a series of interviews and online examinations. We realize these are challenging and can require a decent amount of time so we thank you in advance for your efforts.

items.title: PhishMe: Security Production Engineer
items.content:
Security Production Engineer

Posted Oct 2

PhishMe
Headquarters: Leesburg, VA
phishme.com/company/careers

PhishMe is seeking an experienced Security Production Engineer. As a Security Production Engineer, you will play a critical role in effectively building, maintaining and improving the security of our organization's systems, platform, and infrastructure.  You will be responsible for the development/deployment of tooling that will support the monitoring and managing the security in our environments.  You will also work with other security focused engineers to manage traditional systems and network security tools such as web application firewalls, DDoS service, HIDS and more designed to protect our customers and business against malicious external attacks.  

 You will have the opportunity to influence and design current strategies and procedures for securing our environments.  You will directly influence the application configuration, deployment process of our application and create tools to improve our processes, monitoring and application infrastructure

 This role will report to a Director of Production Engineering.  

 This is a full-time position working for PhishMe, Inc. Outsourced or software development contractors will not be considered.

 Responsibilities
 
  • Work across engineering and development teams to establish and enforce security practices and procedures in the building of environments and deployment of code
  • Implementation, configuration, and management of security tooling for hosts and applications
  • Perform vulnerability identification and remediation including patch management for systems and networks
  • Management of AWS Security including best practices, security groups, user access
  • Management and configuration of security tooling including web application firewall, HIDS, VPN, and more
  • Remediation of reported infrastructure or platform vulnerabilities, exploits, and threats
  • Management of user access, roles, and permissions to critical services
  • System hardening according to industry best practices
  • Cross-team work with the various product offerings within PhishMe
  • Provide support to Sales Engineering in developing responses to RFP/RFQs

Your general milestones are as follows:

  • Within the first month – while working with engineers on the teams, be able to jump head-first into enhancing the platform and ask the appropriate questions / do the appropriate research to identify the general functions and behaviors of the system. (You have built out a local development environment and will participate in some of the regular/operational tasks. Part of the participation you will improve upon the process and documented bringing your experience/perspective).
  • Within three months – have proficient knowledge of the platform and be able to take the reins around backlog items and appropriately develop and implement solutions to the platform. (You will have either written a new Chef Cookbook/Ansible Role or optimized an existing. You will have deployed or modified existing AWS infrastructure via Terraform)
  • Within six to nine months – be able to navigate the full stack of the platform and supporting components, contributing directly to engineering discussions that affect the current and future state of the applications. Essentially, contributing to the team at your full capacity. (You have determined gaps/inefficiencies within PhishMe and have written an engineering case to justify the mitigate of these concerns.  You will design/build/document this solution using your language of choice (assuming code is involved) and all system/infra will be deployed with Chef/Ansible and Terraform). You will have completed an integration between Gitlab and JumpCloud to support onboarding new employees.

The above statements are neither intended to be an all-inclusive list of the duties and responsibilities of the job described, nor are they intended to be a listing of all of the skills and abilities required to do the job. Rather, they are intended only to describe the general nature of the job. This job description is not a contract of employment, either express or implied. Employment with PhishMe will be voluntarily entered into and your employment is considered at will. PhishMe reserves the right to alter the job description at any time without notice.

Qualifications

  • You need to be always shipping - writing code, remediating vulnerabilities (or assisting), documenting, solving problems or assisting development/operations
  • Comfortable with a fast-moving development pace
  • Chef and/or Ansible (bonus points for InSpec)
  • Centos / Ubuntu background

Successful applicants must demonstrate:

  • A strong interest in the field of information security
  • A good knowledge of IT security fundamental concepts
  • Actively working / participant in a Devop’s environment

Additional experience that would be preferable:

  • AWS environment builds/security groups
  • Github/Git usage
  • Signal Sciences, JumpCloud, Jenkins, OSSEC HIDS and Zscaler

Preferred Certifications:

  • Chef
  • AWS
  • CISSP
  • SSCP
  • CCSP
  • SANS Certs

Compensation

  • Competitive salary and incentive stock options
  • 401k plan with company match
  • Health, vision, dental, disability, and life insurance
  • Telecom expense reimbursement

Location

  • Full-time Telecommute (The United States only)
 

PhishMe is committed to equal employment opportunity. We will not discriminate against employees or applicants for employment on any legally recognized basis [protected class] including, but not limited to: veteran status, uniform service member status, race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, physical or mental disability, genetic information or any other protected class under federal, state, or local law.

Apply for this position

To apply for this position, please follow the link below:https://careers-phishme.icims.com/jobs/search?ss=1&searchKeyword=Principal+Software+Engineer%2C+Windows

items.title: Software Engineer Team Lead (remote) - Kickboard - (Remote) - FullTime
items.content:
• Kickboard (Remote)
  • Fulltime Job

    • Software Engineer Team Lead (remote)

    About

    At Kickboard, we’re looking for an ambitious, thoughtful and experienced software engineer to lead our growing engineering team. In this role, you’ll be fully responsible for the engineering side of our company, including engineering process, architecture, people management, recruitment, and growth.

    This could be a perfect fit if…

    1. Your team describes you as someone who knows when to let them work through problems, when to jump in to help, and what questions to ask to create clarity and forward motion

    2. The opportunity to step into a leadership role, to help fellow engineers develop new skills and advance in their careers, and still be able to roll up your sleeves and write code alongside your team excites you

    3. You want to build technology that helps educators create transformative learning environments for their students

    Kickboard works to give educators the tools they need to create safe and happy schools where students and staff thrive. Promoting equity is a priority for Kickboard both internally and within the schools we serve, and we are intentional about creating a diverse and inclusive environment for teammates to do their best work.

    Responsibilities:

    • In the first 12 months, you’ll likely spend 75% of your time on software development, and 25% on people and process management. That ratio should flip in year 2.
    • Write code every day. Develop, test, and deploy features across the entire stack alongside your teammates
    • Lead a distributed team of full stack engineers (mix of full time and contract)
    • Manage the agile development process
    • Lead the charge on automation, continuous integration, and security
    • Recruit, build and scale the engineering team, with support from HR
    • Shape and define the engineering culture
    • Collaborate closely with our product team to define, plan, and prioritize our product roadmap
    • Network externally and attend/present/host at local meetups and national conferences to help build our brand awareness

    Your technical expertise includes…

    • If you have some but not all of this experience, we encourage you to apply anyway.
    • Developing, maintaining and scaling SaaS web applications using an Object oriented framework and typical database infrastructure
    • Developing with PHP, React.js or AngularJS
    • Migrating services to AWS or similar cloud services
    • Familiarity with administering Linux based cloud hosted servers
    • Adoption of continuous integration and automated deployment
    • Working with git or other version control software
    • Enthusiasm for incorporating testing methodologies

    Your management/leadership expertise includes…

    • Leading agile/scrum teams
    • Taking complex ideas/features and creating realistic plans/schedule for team to adhere to
    • Technical planning and drafting technical requirements from business requirements
    • Performing code reviews to ensure quality for entire project
    • Keeping a remote team on the same page and motivated
    • Mentoring and growing a team of high-achieving, curious engineers

    Benefits:

    • Competitive salary and stock options
      Work alongside colleagues who love to learn and grow
      Comprehensive health insurance plan
      401(k) retirement plan
      Generous parental leave policy
      Three weeks paid vacation plus 10 company holidays


      How to apply:
      Please submit your resume and a cover letter that addresses the following:

      1. Why you want to be Software Engineering Team Lead at Kickboard
      2. How you approach engineering management
      3. The team you’re most proud of supporting, and your role in helping it succeed


      Equal Opportunity Employer
      Kickboard is a strong team because of the diverse backgrounds of our staff. This includes professional background, domain expertise, culture, race/ethnicity, sexual orientation, gender identity and expression, language, political beliefs, and hobbies. We strongly encourage women, minorities, and people from underrepresented backgrounds to apply. Kickboard will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records, pursuant to applicable law.

    How to apply

    https://www.kickboardforschools.com/careers/apply/software-engineering-team-lead

items.title: Senior Rails Developer @ Semaphore CI
items.content:
Senior Rails Developer @ Semaphore CI

2017-09-27 14:04

Description

Semaphore is a leader in hosted continuous integration and deployment, with over 30,000 developers relying on Semaphore to test and deploy their code. Our mission is to help teams ship their software faster and with more confidence by providing a robust and scalable platform for software delivery.

The Product Team is responsible for all user-facing experience of our platform. Our platform provides continuous delivery services for all mainstream programming languages as well as native support for building and shipping Docker containers. We aim to deliver the easiest to use and fastest CI/CD service. We work in small highly effective teams, so every team member is vital to the success of the company.

We're looking for collaborative, detail-oriented people who are ready for a challenge. In this role, you'll have the opportunity to take significant ownership of technical projects that will drive the success of the overall business. A strong candidate will bring solid product and technical acumen, combined with the ability to move fast (and fix things).

Examples of problems you'll be solving:
  • Shipping awesome Semaphore features
  • Maintaining and improving the internal and external APIs of Semaphore
  • Automating the release process, monitoring, and solving scalability issues
  • Optimizing the performance of components for both latency and throughput
  • Helping our customers to improve and automate their software delivery pipeline
  • Contributing to and collaborating on Open Source software
Requirements
  • You have 5+ years of software engineering experience and are comfortable writing code in Ruby (and using Rails).
  • You have highly developed debugging skills and ability to solve problems on production systems
  • You care about building maintainable, efficient, clean code.
  • You have excellent written communication skills, including proven ability to work remotely.
  • You are self-managed and capable of making effective decisions.
  • You love helping other developers work more dexterously.
  • You are able to take responsibility for projects end-to-end from idea to completion.
  • You can work with four hours overlap with Central European Timezone
  • Other people at the companies you worked for wanted you on their projects.
Benefits
  • The impact of working on a product that's competing on a global market.
  • Join a small team of around 20 full-time people who love what they do.
  • A healthy 40-hour work week, friendly and supportive work environment.
  • Competitive salary.
  • Company retreats.
  • Space to learn continuously and choose the tools and equipment for your job
  • Paid trips to conferences and books of your choice.
  • Interact with developers that use Semaphore and talk about latest and greatest way to develop and ship software.
  • Paid membership at a fitness club of your choice

Semaphore is an equal opportunity employer. Consistent with our mission of serving a diverse and global audience, we value a diverse workforce and inclusive culture which reflects that. We encourage applications from all qualified individuals without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, national origin, marital status, disability, and veteran status.

Country

Anywhere*

Location

Please apply if you reside within 4hrs of CET

items.title: Frontend Developer - Winners of Sunday Times 'Best Company to Work for'!
items.content:
*Simply Business – We are looking for a Frontend Developer*

If you’re smart, passionate about technology and enjoy solving complex technical challenges then you should apply to join our best-in-class tech team. We believe that people are our most important asset and one worth protecting. As such, we’re known for creating an enviable working culture to keep our employees smiling on a day to day basis.

*In fact, our impressive and enjoyable working culture has earned us 1st place winners in the 'Sunday Times Top 100 Best Companies to Work for' - two years in a row!*

*The role*

* Working on our responsive website & various projects and pushing the boundaries with modern technologies
* Collaborating with tech and business teams to deliver customer focused products
* Working alongside product and UX teams to analyse business requirements
* Helping us continually improve by suggesting new technologies, tools and ways of working
* Taking ownership of projects and driving them forward


*Some things we believe in*

* Agile / Lean / TDD / BDD / Continuous Delivery (we release software to production about 14 times a day on average) / cross functional teams working together on projects (Dev/QA/UX/product) / Active participation in open source
* Never chaining ourselves to a technology – always experimenting and ‘using the right tool for the job’
* Thought leadership – we host meetup groups and present talks in our office and the community
* Creating a great working environment and culture (modern open plan office, flexible hours, remote working, regular team events, paid company holidays abroad, afterwork clubs – like UX, Robotic, Data science clubs, ruby coding challenges over pizza, lunchtime TED talks and lot’s more!)
* Continuous learning – we look to pay for conferences and courses. Recently we have sent some of our Devs out to Miami, Portugal and Barcelona for tech events and conferences (paid for).

*What we are looking for*

*Essential:*

* Expertise with HTML, CSS and JavaScript
* Awareness of users/strong customer-focus
* Interest in good front-end architecture & practices
* Able to communicate well with tech & non-tech colleagues
* Ability to analyse & discuss business requirements and ask the right questions
* Understanding and appreciation for Agile practices

*Desirable (not essential):*

* Experience with SASS
* Experience with React and Redux
* Full stack development skills
* JavaScript testing experience (Jasmine, Mocha etc)
* Git


*Our tech stack*

We are currently using technologies such as HTML5, CSS3, SASS, HAML, JavaScript, React, Redux, JQuery, CoffeeScript, Ruby on Rails, MongoDB, RabbitMQ, Puppet, Boxen, AWS, Cucumber, RSpec, Jasmine, amongst others. *You do not need to be experienced in this entire tech stack to apply*

*What we can offer*

* Flexible working hours and working from home
* A multi-award winning working culture and environment
* Life insurance, 5% pension scheme & childcare vouchers
* A ‘pick & mix’ benefits package consisting of:
- Gym membership
- Private medical care
- Dental cover
- Extra holidays, and more!
* Money back on daily well-being costs (massage, contact lenses etc)
* A fun & social working environment
* The opportunity to work with a best-in-class team who are at the forefront of tech providing thought
leadership and hosting meetup groups in our office and presenting talks on the subject
* Company trips abroad (paid for!) - We’ve been Brussels twice and Barcelona over the last few years!
* Career development – we look to fund relevant training courses and conference
* Free daily breakfast, snacks & hot & cold drinks
* A company that drives continuous innovation with forthnightly and annual hackathons


*Awards and Achievements*

* Winner of the ‘Top 100 Best Companies to Work for 2015’ – Sunday Times
* 3 Star (highest) accreditation in “Best Small Companies to Work for” – Best Companies Ltd 2015 & 2016
* Business Intelligence Project of the Year – Tech, Data & Analytics Awards 2015
* ‘Best Use of Audience Insight’ – Digi Awards
* “Use of Organic Search (SEO)” Dadi Awards
* Accredited “Geared for Giving employer” – outstanding contributions to charity
* “Most Agile Aware Organisation Award” – Agile Awards
* “Best Use of Mobile Technology Award” – Technology in Insurance Awards
* Named in the “Deloitte Technology Fast 500 EMEA”
* Listed in “Sunday Times Tech Track 100” for fastest growing technology companies

*Where we are*

Bank, City of London

*How to Apply*

*Please apply though this workinstartups website as this is currently the only way onto our applicant tracking system*
*Please apply though this workinstartups website as this is currently the only way onto our applicant tracking system*

Due to the volume of applications we receive across the entire business, we unfortunately cannot respond to each applicant with individual feedback. If you have not heard from us within 5 working days then please assume you have been unsuccessful.

items.title: Web Developer (Back-End + Front-End + Basic Design) - Baymard Institute - (Remote) - FullTime
items.content:
• Baymard Institute (Remote)
  • Fulltime Job

    • Web Developer (Back-End + Front-End + Basic Design)

    Are you a back-end programmer who cares about design? Or a front-end developer who knows Ruby?

    Would you like to envision and develop the web platform for a team of dedicated usability researchers conducting cutting-edge e-commerce research used by UX teams at some of the biggest brands in the world (clients include Nike, Lenovo, Etsy, etc.)?

    Then apply for the following full-time job at Baymard Institute – either working remotely or in Copenhagen, Denmark (or a mix!).

    About the Job

    Baymard Institute is a small independent web usability research organization, specialized in conducting large-scale generic usability studies of e-commerce sites. These studies are published as industry reports and benchmark databases at baymard.com (this site is a big part of the web platform you’ll be working on) – which is being used by thousands of web professionals, all the way from the independent freelance web designer to the UX Director of a Fortune 500 company.

    In this position you will have a lot of influence on the technical direction of the company since all Baymard employees are e-commerce UX researchers except one (Jamie, co-founder of the business, and the person you’ll be working most closely together with). It’s an opportunity to help envision and build the technical platform of a company that works with tech but doesn’t sell it. (Because of this we’re also more than happy to open-source our internal code and scripts.)

    If you’re looking for a chance to work on long-term goals rather than chasing monthly user growth targets, this will be a good match. We’re a business that has been profitable from day one and we really don’t care about temporarily spiking our user metrics in order to flip the company or impress VC investors. We’re much more interested in steady and sustainable improvements to our business – continually increasing the value we deliver to our customers (from which sustained increases in profitability organically follow). Since all of Baymard’s research is delivered through its website, your work will have an immediate and tangible impact on the company.

    We want to work with the smartest and most dedicated people around the world, and all of our positions are therefore open to full-time remote work. In other words, you are welcome to work with us from any location you prefer (which many of our employees do). If you want to, you’re of course also welcome to work in our Copenhagen-based office.

    Salary: in accordance with qualifications.

    Start date: preferably before the end of 2017.

    Job Requirements

    You’re skills and interests must span from design to back-end coding. Strong skills in one area can compensate for a weaker side in other areas, but you’ll regularly be working across the spectrum of back-end programming, front-end code, and user interface design, and therefore must have basic skills in all these areas – and even more importantly: enjoy working in all of them!

    Specifically, we’re looking for:

    • Back-end skills – basic programming chops is a requirement for this position, and solid back-end skills is considered a major plus. Familiarity with Ruby is a bonus, but by no means a necessity.
    • Front-end skills – you should be confident in JavaScript and CSS, be able to appreciate concepts such as progressive enhancement, and care deeply about how all of these things tie together and how they impact the end-user experience.
    • Design skills – while we’re definitely not looking for a graphic designer, you must be curious about design and how it shapes users’ perceptions, and enjoy thinking through and tweaking the user interfaces you’re building.
    • Interest in UX and e-commerce is a bonus, but no experience or skills are necessary in this area as you’ll work with (and have the option to be trained by) the best in the business.

    We furthermore expect you to be fluent in english, comfortable working remotely via digital platforms and willing to do a few yearly travels for team meetups (expect 2-5 weeks of travel each year).

    Application

    If you’re interested in this position please send the following (listed in order of importance):

    1. Samples of back-end code you’ve written.
    2. Samples of front-end code you’ve written.
    3. Samples of user interfaces you’ve designed, been involved in designing, or helped implement (please indicate your level of involvement).
    4. Other information you find relevant (hobbies, interests, work experience, CV, ..).

    Note: open-source contributions are perfectly fine as code samples – simply send along / point us towards whatever “work” you feel best represents your skills.

    Deadline is October 13, 2017. However, we’ll review applications on an ongoing basis, so earlier applicants do have a better chance. All applications and materials are kept strictly confidential.

    How to apply

items.title: Full Stack Lead Developer
items.content:
£45,000-£75,000 salary plus 2-5% equity.

Our story:
Focaldata is an award-winning startup that uses the latest techniques in probabilistic programming and AI to understand and predict public opinion. Our technology is used in genuinely impactful areas like political campaigns, informing government policy and business strategy.

The founders’ backgrounds are product in Silicon Valley, data science in London and a PhD in Physics at Oxford.

We want to help organisations engage people in relevant conversations. This involves democratising access to the complex data analytics that recent campaigns have utilised. All companies should be able to understand how to engage the public - big or small - and with focaldata’s platform, they can.

Most recently, our analytics solution for a major client was cited in Reuters, Guardian and the Telegraph, and we won CogX AI Political Product of the Year 2017 out of 350 competing startups. We use the same techniques as YouGov, who recently appeared on the front page of the Times newspaper, having successfully forecasted who would win the General Election 2017.

We have just closed a large pre-seed round, and are recruiting an experienced team to scale quickly. We want entrepreneurial, talented individuals to join us, think like founders, and help build something of real value. This is a role which has real impact on the world, in a cutting-edge part of data science.

Our product:
Focaldata is a technology platform for deep consumer insight. We use cutting-edge data science to dramatically improve the accuracy and granularity of traditional polling. This helps organisations genuinely understand public opinion.

Our platform ingests raw survey microdata, analyses and processes it, outputting the results to our visualisation portal. We’re primarily built in Python, but believe in using the best technology for the task. Our current stack includes Docker, Circle CI, AWS (EC2, S3, Elasticbeanstalk, ECR).

We are looking for people who share our desire to deliver exceptional data analysis through simple, quality products. As a core member of our engineering team, you will build and improve our product, especially our analytics pipeline, add new features, and help define our engineering roadmap.

Our data science:
We do cutting-edge data science. We use Stan, a probabilistic programming language, which we implement in Python, to build complex multilevel models of the population, from demographic information in surveys and government data.

Such techniques are computationally intensive, requiring careful cloud computing management, but return powerful full-probability estimates of parameters, and allow highly complex models from limited survey data (for each response has an associated cost).

Job responsibilities:
- Development of our core product from restricted alpha, including APIs and data infrastructure to power our automated analytics engine
- Resolution of database formats for optimal speed of frontend service
- Making architectural decisions as the system grows
- Product management in an Agile environment
- Identifying team weaknesses, recruiting and encouraging professional development

This role will suit you if you:
- Have deep technical experience in full stack development in a startup environment
- Are comfortable taking responsibility for the full technology stack and leading teams
- Have deep knowledge of Python, Django, Amazon Web Services, Docker, a host of database management technologies, and frontend customer interaction on a website
- Have scaled up technologies for a growth company in the past
- Take initiative, love learning and reading widely
- Are keen to stay up to date on the latest developments in open source
- Come up with ideas and enjoy experimentation
- Move fast; you will help steer the company to its optimal technology backend as it expands quickly
- Are thorough, rigorous and enjoy test-driven development

Job benefits:
- Competitive salary (£45,000-£75,000 p/a) and strong equity incentive (2-5% equity): negotiable dependent on preferences for salary vs equity
- Team experience in London/Silicon Valley startup scenes and Oxbridge academia
- Opportunity to build a culture and product by joining a fast growing startup at an early stage
- Chance to work on genuinely impactful areas that matter
- Dynamic, highly technical team that are at the forefront of probabilistic programming
- Regular social evenings in our friendly team
- Open to occasional remote working
- Paid for training and education, huge emphasis on learning including regular time off

To apply, please send us your CV (no cover letters).

items.title: Senior Django Developer
items.content:

The company is well established within the industry, and has significant traction with high profile museums, galleries and art shippers. We are set to dominate the market and become an industry standard.

We are looking for a senior developer with startup experience. The Articheck platform currently consists of a Django site, together with an iOS client. The main responsibilities of the role would be:

Choosing the right technologies and frameworks to allow the product to scale as the customer base and database of artwork condition reports grows
Plenty of hands-on coding of backend web services and new features
Working with CTO to meet the IT needs of a growing company

The ideal candidate would have the following:

Expertise in server side development in Python/Django
Experience across the full stack
Linux server administration and Amazon AWS experience
Proven track record of having lead roles designing and developing web-based applications
Belief in the importance of writing clean, readable and maintainable code
A self-starter who is comfortable working remotely
A confident communicator, both written and verbal
Great command of the English language


At Articheck, we believe in a great work life balance. We are based in London but will consider applicants in other nearby time zones (ie, EST). The salary range is £45,000 - £65,000, depending on experience and equity package selected.

To apply, please send us your CV, as well as links to any GitHub profiles, blogs, or sites you have developed, etc. No recruiters please. bernard@articheck.com

items.title: Developer Advocate @ Canonical
items.content:
Developer Advocate @ Canonical

2017-09-22 14:09

Description

We are seeking an experienced Developer Advocate to join a globally-distributed team driving advocacy for Snapcraft (https://snapcraft.io), the revolutionary new software delivery platform, and Ubuntu Core the optimised version of Ubuntu for IoT (https://ubuntu.com/core).

Through direct engagement with software vendors and developers we deepen our understanding of what makes software delivery hard. We follow these individuals through the process of publishing in Snapcraft, reporting back to our engineering teams so the next vendor has an even smoother experience. Where strategically important, we assist in engineering solutions.

This is a role that requires passion and exceptional interpersonal skills. Those who excel can walk into a conference and immediately approach strangers, swiftly navigating a web of conversations until they’ve identified the most important themes and established contacts with key players for follow-on conversations.

Our objective is to grow the Snapcraft platform to tens of thousands of developers and hundreds of millions of devices. We are data-driven, creative, and ambitious.

About you:

  • An enthusiastic self-starter
  • Phenomenal communicator, an avid listener with above-average recall
  • Strong software engineering background
  • Good troubleshooting instincts and undaunted by unfamiliar tools
  • Strong technical writing skills, to be employed in authoring documentation and training material
  • Strategic and creative thinker who can effectively navigate a boundless potential target set
  • Can work autonomously and assume full ownership of objectives as needed
  • Comfortable with Linux-based operating systems, such as Ubuntu
  • Comfortable with online communication and collaboration, such as mailing lists, Google Hangouts, and Slack

What we offer:

  • Competitive salary and equity
  • Home working
  • Flexible work schedule
  • Travel to and speak at events and customer locations around the world
  • Work on software used by tens of millions of people every day

Country

Anywhere*

Location

Europe or North America

items.title: Full Stack Developper
items.content:
*Job description*

Do you like working with data? Do you want to make an impact in a start-up? Do you live for Django, AngularJS, continuous deployment, agile development and microservices? If you answered yes to all those questions then keep reading!

CGscope is a London-based tech and research start-up led by young but experienced professionals. It originated as a spin-off of a well-established consultancy, which has specialised in corporate governance for over 13 years. The goal of CGscope is to extract valuable governance information that is buried in thousands of pages of annual reports and supervisory filings by applying machine learning techniques.

It’s an exciting time to join our small, extremely motivated, team here at CGscope, and we have big visions for the future. We’ve secured funding, we’re working towards a live product, and we’re now forming our technology team. We are seeking exceptional developers who identify with our core software architecture, and are prepared to have a huge impact on the product and our company culture, are willing to take ownership of problems end to end, and are able to make difficult decisions.

We think in terms of microservices rather than a monolithic system, and our stack builds on Google Cloud Platform. As a full stack developer, your main responsibility will be continuing the development of the CGscope website and database, and you will work closely with our research team to deliver the best possible user experience in the corporate governance sector. More specifically, you will: maintain our code base, design, implement and test new features, and monitor our live system.

In return, we offer a great place to work, with people from diverse backgrounds, the chance of taking responsibility, being trusted and valued in the team, and the rare opportunity of experiencing and shaping a start-up.


*Skills & Requirements*

Required:
* 2+ years of experience in commercial software development or another tech environment
* Proficiency in object-oriented software development and automated testing
* Strong programming skills in Python and JavaScript
* Familiarity in using and programming relational databases
* Experience in Django and AngularJS
* Solid understanding of how to build APIs and REST based microservices
* Good communication skills in English
* Ability to work in a team, which focuses on sharing knowledge and learning new things, but also autonomous

Desirable:
* University degree in computer science or equivalent
* Experience in managing software projects
* Knowledge of frontend development techniques/frameworks like Semantic UI, CSS
* Experiences with non-relational databases, e.g. Redis or MongoDB
* Know-how of continuous deployment systems, e.g. Jenkins
* Comfortable working with task queues and message brokers like Celery, RabbitMQ
* Understanding of microservices as a software architecture and containerization, e.g. Docker and Kubernetes
* Familiarity with Agile software development, Scrum, Kanban and Phabricator
* Sample work on Bitbucket, GitHub or Stack Overflow

Organizational:
* London-based or willingness to relocate to London
* Allowed to work in the UK

_Please no recruitment agencies, thank you._
_We are exclusively looking for full-time, we do not work with contractors._
_For foreigners, unfortunately, we are not able to sponsor visa applications._

*Life at CGscope*

We have great benefits

* Flexible working hours, including working remotely
* High level of autonomy
* Choose your own gear
* Awesome team to work with
* 28 days of paid vacation
* Competitive salary & employee ownership schemes
* Cycle to work & child benefit schemes
* Stipend for learning material, training and conferences
* Evening desk beers & office video game consoles

items.title: ReactJS, front end tech lead
items.content:
We're looking to hire a senior front end developer, with experience of, or interest in ReactJS to work mostly on new projects here in Cardiff. We're a fast growing tech startup, with a great work life balance and a real interest in helping you develop your career. We're open to remote and flexible working (perhaps you'd like to do 4 days a week, or you need to be away for nursery pickup at 3.30).

Spec your own development machine, and work in a company that takes tech seriously and likes to do it well.

You'll be comfortable taking a lead on architecture and technology choices, and enjoy working with other great developers.

Your main duties will include:
Working on a small team designing and implementing our new Shopify integration. This will consume our backend APIs, and be built in React JS. You will take the lead on architectural and other standards.

We’d like someone who:
Takes the initiative- we’re a small company still, so we’ll expect you to take ownership of whatever you work on.
Wants to grow with us. As we continue to grow, you’ll be called on to take more responsibility, mentor others and lead teams
Likes automation. Our tech team is currently 3, and we process and print over a million items a month. We manage this by automating aggressively.

Experience that would be useful (though we’re open minded):
React JS - design and coding experience. Or experience in another front-end framework such as Angular
Should know your way around HTML, CSS etc
Shopify integrations/apps
Experience in SPAs and Progressive Web Apps
We use lots of other stuff too- but if you’re the right candidate, you’ll enjoy picking up any new tools or frameworks you don’t already know

items.title: JavaScript Software Engineer (Contractor)
items.content:
Software Engineer (Contractor)

Overview

At YLD we believe that in the future all companies will be software companies, and we are now seeing this shift taking place across the business world. Do you want to be a part of realising this for our clients, some of the most successful businesses and FTSE-100 companies? Help define the future: today.

About The Contract

We are looking for experienced back-end, front-end and full-stack contractors with Node.js experience.

You will work on delivering digital transformation projects at FTSE-100 companies, all of them household names, using technologies such as Node.js and React.

A YLD Software Engineering Consultant is a highly-skilled developer who exemplifies the highest standard in software engineering and enjoys sharing his/her knowledge and experience with others.

This contract offers the opportunity to work with some of the most talented developers in their respective fields.

About YLD

YLD is a fast-growing, London-based software engineering consultancy passionate about enabling digital transformations for Enterprise companies.

We are a strong proponent of continuous delivery and rigorous testing practices, and we help our customers move towards modern best-practices with minimal risk. We educate, co-develop, and automate, passing on our expertise to our customers’ development teams in the process.

We hire the best and believe that bringing extraordinary people together produces great results.

YLD have offices in London and Lisbon.

About You

You will have experience in many of the following technologies: Node.js, JavaScript, HTML, CSS, various front-end frameworks (e.g. Angular, React, etc.) and an understanding of back-end architecture, scalability and deployments (even if in languages other than Node.js); .NET and Java are advantageous.

Pair programming, continuous delivery, test driven development, and incremental design should be second nature to you; writing code without tests should be unthinkable.

You have a real passion for software development, having contributed to open-source projects and written or spoken in public about your work. You are an active learner, and a good teacher.

Prerequisites

You are a highly experienced software developer with a consistent record
Strong command of the English language (both verbal and written)
Legally able to stay and work in the UK
Technical competencies:
Experience in Node.js and React development in production
Application development experience of the following technologies: JavaScript, databases (both relational and schema-less), Linux, HTML, CSS and some sort of modern front-end framework
A strong focus on continuous integration and delivery
Strong test focus, experience with latest tooling
Building high-performance and scalable applications
A working knowledge of application security, authentication and related cryptography
Good understanding of design and implementation of RESTful web services
Knowledge of Agile software development process
Familiarity with performance monitoring tools
You can keep a cool-head when debugging production issues
Non-technical competencies:
Problem-solving skills that balance innovation with pragmatic technology choices to solve business needs
Comfortable working dynamic production environment and take care of client expectations effectively
Distinct customer focus and quality mindset
Willingness to travel to be on-site with our customers
Prepared to speak publicly about your work, and YLD’s work
An exemplar of YLD’s brand and safe-guarder of our reputation


We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

items.title: PHP Developer - Doghouse Agency - (Remote) - FullTime
items.content:

    About

    Doghouse is a full service Digital Agency with our head office in Perth, Western Australia. We are a highly-technical agency, with a focus on building quality software through open-source frameworks such as Drupal and Magento.

    At the core of Doghouse is our award winning team of developers, producers, designers, engineers and architects. Our strategy is to expand our border through extending our team into Europe and the Americas.

    For the successful candidates, this represents an opportunity to learn and grow with our business, sharing our continued success and working closely with our Australian team.

    We’re looking for full time PHP developers with demonstrated PHP, CSS + HTML, Jquery and source control experience and a sound understanding of the LAMP stack.

    Substantial commercial experience with Drupal and Magento, involvement in the open source development community, and familiarity with web development best practices is highly regarded.

    • Highly experienced with JavaScript, jQuery, HTML, SASS

items.title: Front-end Javascript Developer
items.content:
*Front-end Javascript Developer*

Here at Tallysticks, we are revolutionising trade finance through blockchain technology and are now looking for to grow the team.

Tallysticks is a young start up, around since 2015, and we have developed an exciting and industry-changing solution to a problem many SMEs that work in big supply chains face: cash flow and trade finance. Our solution is a portal that SMEs, large corporates and financiers can access to help with this funding gap by utilising blockchain technology.

We have developed an award-winning product and now want to tweak the the product and further develop our portal based on user feedback.

*_We are looking for someone who:_*

* Wants to build an industry-changing blockchain product
* Can take ownership from the get-go and work with minimal guidance
* Ideally has experience of building enterprise applications in Financial Services
* Has experience and a proven track record building beautiful and powerful single-page apps

*_The Details_*

* Immediate start but we’ll wait for the right person
* £45k-£65k & equity negotiable based on experience
* The position is based at Rise London, Shoreditch with some travel required
* We offer flexi-time but cannot offer remote work

*_Responsibilities_*

* Communicate with designers and back-end developers to produce performant, well-written user interface projects with great UX
* Work with the technical and commercial team to make technical decisions and consolidate product delivery
* Primarily, to deliver the product a number of clients ranging from SMEs to large corporates
* Required Experience
* Min. 4 years experience with JavaScript, HTML 5, CSS3 (existing projects on GitHub or elsewhere)
* Has experience of web paradigms such as SPAs, JWTs, REST, WebSockets
* Linux command line including Git
* Good knowledge of modern JavaScript (ES6+) without frameworks
* Build and automation tools such as Gulp & Webpack
* Excellent knowledge of browser networking, performance and the latest DOM APIs
* Good knowledge and experience writing large/complex CSS, with pre-processors
* Experience with Vue.js (or React)

*_Desired experience_*

* Experience building complex UIs for Financial Services industry
* Server-side Node.js experience
* Experience in distributed ledgers, decentralized applications and blockchain platforms such as Ethereum and Hyperledger

items.title: Payments Engineer
items.content:
*Payments Engineer*

Tallysticks is a trade finance solution that addresses the large unmet demand of SME importers and exporters the world over. Whilst SMEs account for 90% of all sales domestically, they account for less than 10% of all international sales. We have redefined the current and outdated international trade finance process to allow SMEs to access financing more readily.  

*_Commercial Requirements of the Role_*

Our current product helps our customers create, negotiate, and agree international (container shipping) sales contracts with ease. The next steps will be to support multi-currency payments, escrow services and lending (trade finance) within the same online portal.

To facilitate this, we are building a bespoke digital wallet system based on a distributed ledger. We are looking for a talented software engineer with experience in banking, payments or cryptocurrency exchanges to join our team become our go-to technical lead on all things payments.

The role will be hands-on, but this is a senior role and you will be expected help our CTO lead the technical direction of the product, take part in broader discussions in the company, and mentor less experienced engineers.

*_Salary and Benefits_*

* Immediate start but we’ll wait for the right person
* £50k-£80k & equity negotiable based on experience
* The position is based at Rise London, Shoreditch with some travel required
* We offer flexi-time but cannot offer remote work ; we cannot sponsor visas

*_Our Current Stack_*

* NodeJS back-end implemented as microservices
* PostgreSQL, and Sequelize to interact with it
* Redis
* Private ethereum blockchain
* VueJS front-end
* Docker on AWS EC2

We are open to you deciding on which technologies are the best to solve the problem

*_Responsibilities_*

* Communicate with designers and developers to produce performant, well-written user interface projects with great UX
* Work with the technical and commercial team to design and implement product features.
* Primarily, to deliver the product a number of clients ranging from SMEs to large corporates
* To take on ownership of the product from the get-go

*_Required Experience_*

* Min. 4+ years experience building payments systems in a finance or enterprise environment
* Solid understanding of all aspects of online payment processing: interacting with financial systems, product and promotion pricing, product fulfillment, event tracking to feed into reporting systems
* Deep knowledge of at least one statically-typed server-side programming language e.g. Java, Scala, Go, C++ etc. * Experience with Node.js is also a plus.
* Experience working in a microservices architecture
* Familiarised with automated testing, code quality, and engineering best practices
* Solid understanding of SQL databases and database transactions
* Experience building architecture that can scale
* Experience integrating with payment gateways

*_Desired Experience_*

* Comfortable working in different parts of the stack
* Interest in innovations within the global payments industry
* Experience in distributed ledgers, decentralized applications, and blockchain platforms such as Ethereum and Hyperledger
* Experience in working on cryptocurrency exchanges

_NO RECRUITERS_

items.title: [REMOTE WORK]-Full Stack PHP Developer

items.title: Clever, nice person to be a 'matcher' in friendly VC-backed startup
items.content:
*About Koru Kids*

Koru Kids is on a mission to improve childcare in London. We’re making it easier and more affordable for families to access flexible and high quality childcare, by helping them share nannies with other families. This helps bring down the cost of childcare for the parents, means the nanny gets paid more, and gives the children a new friend to play with. Parents have responded enthusiastically, and our network of families is growing very fast.

We are backed by fantastic investors, including top venture capitalists and business angels such as Michael Pennington the founder of Gumtree. We won the South of England region in the ‘Best of Britain’ awards 2017, and are currently shortlisted for several awards: the UK Business Awards 2017 as ‘Disruptor of the Year’, and in the Best Women Awards 2017 as ‘Best New Business’, ‘Best Technology’ and ‘Best company working with children and families’.

*About the Team*

We have an informal, hard-working and kind team culture.
* Our founder is Rachel Carrell, the former CEO of DrThom.com, the world’s largest online doctor service, which she grew to over 1.3m paying users in 3 countries. She’s an Oxford alumn, ex-McKinsey, a Rhodes Scholar and a WEF Young Global Leader.
* Rachel’s joined by an amazing team with backgrounds including Cambridge, UCL, BCG, KPMG, and some of London’s top startups. We take great care with who we hire and all team members are superbly talented. If you’re brilliant AND humble, you’ll fit right in.

We work from a beautiful co-working space near Old St in central London. The office has free snacks and drinks, a gym and showers, bike storage and a programme of social events.

*About the role*

We are growing really fast, and we need someone to come and join our ‘matching’ team. This is the heart of the business, where the magic happens!
* You’ll be responsible for creating happy outcomes every day for parents and nannies, by matching them up so that the nannies can look after the kids. Most of your day will be spent communicating with parents and nannies, over the phone and email, in order to do this matching
* You’ll also have lots of freedom to reflect, analyse, experiment, innovate and improve the way we do things. You’ll be encouraged to think about human psychology, ‘nudges’, messaging and marketing, tracking and analysing data, algorithms and automation – all as part of the job as we improve the way matching works. We’ll welcome your ideas
* You’ll get exposure to all other parts of the business including marketing, finance, software, and operations. At times you might help out with tasks related to these things as well
* You’ll be a core member of our team, and you’ll get all the training, coaching and support you need to do your job well. We’ll invest in your development and help you succeed

Your normal hours of work will be 830am to 6pm, although there may be times when late nights are required to cope with particular ‘spikes’ in demand. We know you have a private life and other commitments and we work as a team to make sure everyone has a good balance. You’ll normally work from our offices near Old St, although if you like to occasionally work from home that’s totally fine too.

3 reasons this role is great:
* You will learn a TON. Customer-facing operations will be your main focus, but you’ll get plenty of exposure to marketing and other aspects of the business. You’ll learn how to found a business, about operations, marketing, technology, and finance. You’ll also be surrounded by other startups trying to grow. If you want to, you can get stuck into the London startup scene, with its evening meetups and events, which is incredibly dynamic and fun.
* You’ll be making a huge difference to the everyday lives of parents in London. We’re building a business that will profoundly benefit children, women, and families.
* We’re well-connected in the startup world, so working with us will open lots of doors for you even if you leave. We’ve got a strong track record of helping people we’ve worked with

*About you*
We’re after an all-rounder who is clever, practical, positive and nice. We don’t mind what degree you’ve done, as long as you’ve done well in it. We’ll also be looking for evidence of drive, aspiration, spark and energy in the extracurricular stuff you’ve done.

Essential skills
* You’re able to write clearly, simply and accurately, with perfect spelling and grammar
* You’re comfortable speaking to new people, both in person and on the phone
* You like working with numbers and data. We love people who love analysis
* You can work at a fast pace and under pressure
* You’re emotionally intelligent. Although you’ll like to talk, the most important thing you’ll do is listen. Choosing childcare is an emotional decision, and you’ll need to help parents through the process
* You’re detail-oriented. We deal with payroll and payments, and the details must be 100% correct
* You’re a problem-solver. As we are a young company, there aren’t many fixed processes yet. That means you can create new processes, make suggestions, and tell us we’re doing things wrong
* You roll with it. You understand that startups are unpredictable environments. You are comfortable with a degree of chaos
* You’re nice. You get that no player is bigger than the team. You fit right into our culture of supporting and helping each other.

items.title: Lead Developer for London Social App
items.content:
We’re on the hunt for an ambitious Lead Developer, who is looking to join a startup with global potential. We’ve built our MVP, raised 2 rounds of investment and are now looking for a talented programmer to lead our product development as we start scaling.

Who are we?
Zone App Ltd is a social start-up house, which turns great ideas into brilliant businesses. The company has created WHERE app, which is on a mission make social tech ‘social’.

VISION: Social technology is currently failing to deliver valuable ‘real-life’ experiences. 

TECHNOLOGY: WHERE changes the way people use social technology by providing them with a live heat map, which displays activities taking place nearby today.  Users receive real-time insight into venues and activities to be inspired by or get involved with. 

MARKET: The initial focus will be on user acquisition within the London social sports market but the app is already adapted to exploit the rest of the global leisure market, which is estimated to be worth c.£2.5 trillion. 

TEAM: WHERE has been developed by a strong and highly motivated, full-time team of 3, each with complementary skills. The team launched the app in June of this year, which has already generated 4,000 active London-based users; a tiny fraction of the market potential in London alone. 

PRESS: WHERE has been selected to be ‘incubated’ by the London Sport Tech Hub and has been featured in Sky News, London Live and Growth Business publication amongst others. 

Company Values

We believe in treating each member of our team as an equal and strive to build products which bring genuine value to our users. We genuinely believe that the sky’s the limit.

We’re a small but mighty, young team of do-ers, finding a balance between thinking big and getting sh*t done. We believe in inspiring to be the following:

1. Ambitious – anything is possible with a can-do attitude

2. Empowered – make intelligent and informed decisions. Ask for forgiveness, not permission

3. Cheeky – don’t accept anything because ‘that’s the way it’s always been’. Be bold and challenge the status quo

Job Description

Together with our COO you will be responsible for determining the product road map, and writing awesome code to shape & scale the product.

Your Responsibilities

Dream big – get excited about the product and create imaginative tech solutions that can impact the world and change the game.
Lead as the senior developer writing reliable code, and building system architecture effective at scale.
Manage a team of remote developers as we grow.

See yourself as a member of the founding team and commit to the success of the company, contributing to miscellaneous tasks outside the scope of the Lead Dev role (marketing, operations, customer service etc) as and when needed.

Experience Required
We are looking for an experienced, full-stack developer for iOS & Android applications
• Capable of building middleware and APIs from scratch 
• Comfortable developing responsive front end UI 
• Expertise in Java and PHP 
• Knowledge of HTML5, CSS3/JS, AngularJS, REST a plus 
• A self-starter who enjoys solving technical challenges with novel solutions 
• 5+ years in development 
• Currently lives in London and speaks English as first language/fluently.
• Qualifications: Bachelors in Science, Technology, Engineering, or Mathematics
• Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal
• Self-motivated with good time-management and ability to work to tight deadlines
• A desire to help create an awesome workplace with passion, dedication, fairness, trustworthiness,
• humility, courtesy, generosity, creativity, and organisation
• Knowledge of technological trends to build strategy

Bonus points for…
Product management experience

UI/UX experience

NB: We are funded by Angel Investors and Share Options are available to the right candidate.

items.title: Lead Mobile Developer iOS & Android
items.content:
Are you looking to join a team that has the potential to shake up the health & fitness industry? Do you want to work on a first to market concept that is going to change the way people interact and exercise?

We are a small team with our first round of investment from a premier investor which enables us to tackle some major issues in the health & fitness sector. Our concept is going to change the way people workout and we need a top mobile developer to optimise, refine and add their flare to our MVP.

We need you to have a portfolio of apps that give us confidence you can take Rig and bring our plans to life in beautiful, simple, engaging ways. We need you to be agile and be able to balance engineering excellence with the business and product needs.

You’ll be working closely with exceptional designers, marketeers and creatives to deliver exceptional execution on the shared vision. The part-time work if performed well can be extended to full time with an ongoing equity stake in the company.

What we expect from you.

Broad understanding of UI and UX concepts-Top Level Swift knowledge-Familiar with Objective-C- Understanding of working with third party API’s- Previous Android development experience- PHP experience- Experience with Git- Experience with HTML, CSS and Javascript.

This position is based in London but we would consider remote working within UK.

items.title: Senior Android Engineer - Coffee Meets Bagel - Remote, OR
items.content:
Senior Android Engineer
Coffee Meets Bagel -Remote, OR
Adventure. Excitement. Purpose.
A developer craves these things, and Coffee Meets Bagel delivers.
---

We are looking for an Android expert to join our world-class Android team. You are an industrious developer with a love for Android and a penchant for design/UX. You are passionate about your work and hungry to make a real impact at a growing start-up. You will guide the architecture of our Android app -- You should have an expert understanding of quality Java and Android application development and the associated technologies, as well as a vision for what an awesome Android app looks like going forward.

We are a tight-knit team of talented engineers, scientists, and designers building a world-class dating app. We're located in the heart of San Francisco (Union Square) with close access to BART and plenty of awesome options for lunch right outside your door. We are passionate about building an awesome experience for our users and are passionate about learning and growing as engineers and professionals.

Requirements
    • At least 3 years experience building and publishing Android apps used by millions of people
    • Expert level knowledge of the Android SDK
    • Penchant for delivering high-quality products with beautiful design
    • An understanding of REST APIs and client-server interactions using Retrofit
    • Expert-level animation skills
    • Experience applying common design patterns (MVP) and writing thorough tests
    • Ability to maintain a stable release process via Jenkins
Coffee Meets Bagel is helping people around the world fall in love and we LOVE what we do! Come to work every day in our slick new office right in downtown off the Powell Street BART station. We have all the usual startup perks including fully stocked snack bar, catered lunches, flexible work hours, unlimited vacation policy, happy hours, and more!

Or work from wherever you are from the comfort of your home or the bustle of your favorite coffee shop. We believe in hiring the best engineers wherever they are and strive to create an inclusive and collaborative work environment, even for remote employees!

Check out our tech engineering blog to get a closer look at what we've got going on under the hood! Or maybe you want some deeper insight on the culture at CMB? Jump over to keyvalues.io to see what our engineering team is all about : )
